79eSH5_62rml1Msb9K4uSg.text: Had dinner here on NYE, there were 4 of us. The look and feel of the place was fine. We ordered chips, salsa and elote for the appetizer, which was good, but the elote was luke warm - a reoccurring theme. For the main course we ordered the Green Chili Chicken(very good), the Carne Asada(they hit the medium rare perfectly).  We also ordered the Scallops and this is where things started to fall apart. The scallops were sandy, as in sand. While this is not unusual, these scallops were inedible. We were picking sand out of our teeth for the rest of the night. The scallops were also undercooked, which we sent back to be  finished. Finally, we had the Lobster Chili Rellenos which was cold.  Over all, we spent $160(tip included). It was not a good value and we won't be going back.

spgg1rf3xha8JHlxONuLyA.text: The 3 tacos for $10 is an making deal!!  All of the tacos are GF. Of all the taco flavors our group's favorite was the green chili pork! The tortillas are A M A Z I N G - soft, thick, dimensional.  Queso appetizer is incredible.  Guac is okay - doesn't even seem they salted or put lime juice in it.  Service was okay/slow.

s4NaEqFYLPw_qxwqxg9sew.text: My life problem with coming here was that I wanted traditional Mexican food, but I was walking around at 2:30pm, which is closing time for many Mom-and-pop Mexicans places in downtown. I eventually made my way to Chico Malo with my friend and had a solid experience.  The restaurant is located in the CityScape, so it has a decent amount of competition bringing people in. Therefore, we had no problems getting two spots in the outdoor section of the bar.   I insisted upon starting off with guac, but my friend hates it. (I know I know...I low key hate him for his disdain of avocados, but I digress.) we ended up getting the trip, which included the bean salad and salsa as well as the guac. I was pleasantly surprised by the flavors and the presentation of the drip trio - if you have read my review of Lachey's in Cincinnati, you know my bad luck regarding dip trios. I munched hard on the dip trio here, and I was having a lot of fun mixing and matching the different dips. They complement each other well and are great starters for your entrees.  We were happy to hear that they were still serving brunch options until 3, so we both opted for items off of that menu. I ordered Chile Rellenos while my friend ordered the eggs Benedict. My Rellenos came out HUGE. It was just a massive amount of food. Unfortunately, soggy chips do not make great leftovers and I found the verde to be rather flavorless. Luckily I had salsa and guac left to help me eat. My friend thoroughly enjoyed his eggs Benedict and it was actually a normal eating amount, so ya know, I was happy for him.  All in all, a solid option in downtown Phoenix, but if the choice arises, maybe get some authentic tacos elsewhere first.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilquiles. Not the best but not the worse - and there&#39;s aloooot of food

mz08O9ob9UTZ3YjtbiVF2A.text: Don't bother making reservations.  They won't hold them for you.  Be sure to ask for the correct menu beforehand - they will give you whatever is available only to tell you they're not serving from that menu.  Food is good even if it takes 30 minutes.  Drinks are overpriced and small.

brO81mmoT6isFPVl-ZogvA.text: First time in Phoenix.  Hotel recommended Chico Malo, beautiful place, nice location, service at the bar was not the best that day.  Didn't feel welcome, so only tried the ship and salsa verde, salsa not good.  Cocktails are decent.  Decided to check another place some friends recommended!

JEIQwzqau5EyTl2uH_Qjow.text: Compare to the other Mexican restaurants in the dowtown area, this is one of the two places we like to go. Their food is unique. Great outdoor bar/patio. Service at bar varies. We ordered the pan seared red snapper. The head and bones were for display which could've been be edible chip if it wasn't a salt lick.

IuL-Z9EnR4q9tXcYC9HePg.text: Surprisingly the Mexican food is descent here. The Guacamole is fantastic, the drink menu is great. The al pastor tacos were a little too sweet in terms of flavor. The thing to get here is the rib eye steak! Omg the meat is full of flavor and it cuts like butter. For $36 you're definitely getting your money's worth but if I had to go back I would just order the Nuevo Guacamole, split the rib eye steak with your friend, and make an attempt for dessert.   Service was okay too. The staff here is very laid back and at one point we waited a long time just to get chips for our guacamole. It wasn't that packed when we went so I'm not sure what that was about. The food was too good for me that it made me forget that incident.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yDdPY2NbF0FWxgS8XUBNXw.text: Grant + Sal were amazing! Great service behind the bar and extensive knowledge on spirits and food. Really enjoyed their company and their service. Attentive to me and my friend and patient with answering our questions. I had a memorable mezcal drink that Grant whipped up on the fly. From out of town, this is my second time here and would definitely recommend again! The elote is the best I've ever had!

9gCxGrdHIXsurBgkUYGgYQ.text: This was honestly one of the most poor dining experiences I've had in some time. A few of the highlights were the dirty appetizer plate with a huge hair included. The margaritas were underwhelming and the waitress snatched one of them from our table that was still 1/3 full. The food was just ok, meaning none of our 3 meals were remotely impressive. Consensus 2 star experience, and I rate everything highly. For the price of this place, go eat 3 times at a good Mexican dining establishment. The 2 stars I did give were the result of the great music. Keep it up dj! Keep trying chef.

5CHA4PQWeaI24OmNT443Hw.text: I liked it. Good service, very good food. Nice atmosphere, the patio was just very pleasant. Our server was very nice and accommodating. Nice modern spin on goos mexican food

5KTX8C9DzqOvFkr9KUSgEg.text: Wow this place was amazing.  Hector was awesome.  Everything we ate was so amazing and prepared with so many different flavors. The drink choice were so creative.  This place is hands down a must.

WqjwT_PXwcxraO_V0gvS9A.text: Sat down at the bar to order drinks and something to snack on before the game and waited for over 15 minutes and didn't get any service. Were presented with menus and were never checked up on again even with attempts to gain the attention of the staff. He even provided service to those around us and never once offered us anything. Multiple people came around other parts of the bar and were served so we walked out. What a bummer!

Cz2GQldtIcFavAzVGxAVYw.text: Wow! What a surprise. Heard about this place from a friend. Decided to make the drive downtown, and boy was it worth it. One of the most unique recipes I have the opportunity to enjoy. From the appetizers to the entrees everything was just great. Our server Krystal was amazing assisting us through the menu and her service was top notch. Food portions are super generous (already think about my leftovers). Looking for something different? Chico Malo is a must try.

6fOfQl_KiTpNsyUWF5ODIA.text: I met a friend here for lunch today and had a great experience!  The tacos were so amazingly delicious...already dreaming about the green chile pork taco (it was truly that good!)!  I also tried the al pastor and the chicken tinga...both flavorful, fresh and downright tasty too.  We'll definitely be back for more amazing tacos!

SDxa7xqyFZ0IeV5kMpyYVw.text: Great food and service. Pete made sure everything was taken care of. Great place for our big group.

l0PEbwi2X6TxBsoZP3jC7w.text: Nice and clean place, Loved the decoration. Great beer selection, But food was disappointing.  On my personal opinion they try to make the food too fancy they forget to give the real authentic Mexican taste.

vh4wTWjnNxG1J6QEKbQQmw.text: Walking into the restaurant was eye catching! Very nice dinning and seating, big fan of the open kitchen and artwork! The service was great and fast. My fiance and I went to have a early dinner we had a total of 6 tacos and a appetizer. Crispy avacodo, Baja fish, Pastor, Chicken Tinga, and papas and chorizo were amaizing, the only one I didn't like was the Carne Asada taco. The taco had great toppings and all blended well, my favorite thing to do when I have tacos is tak a piece of the protein and taste it, always done that. In this case the Carne Asada was bland no taste seemed like no seasoning (nope not even salt and pepper) seems like they wanted to mask the bland beef with all the ingredients in the taco but didn't end up working out. The chorizo con Papas appetizer was really good but prefer it as a taco instead. Overall a great place to have dinner and drinks! Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Asada, Pastor and Baja Fish tacos

pPv6Didtb3cFHlT_2kjLHg.text: Have tried both brunch (Chimichanga and Huevos Carne Asada) and lunch (3 for $10/ tacos and Mexican stew, Duck Tamale) menus - everything was fresh and delicious. Service was superb - shout out to our favorite server and bartender Joe.

RCRc9wl2aRaXTJwGQ7FKpw.text: Was downtown for business and looking for authentic Mexican - the hotel said this was it for something within walking distance.  Awesome ambiance. Great service. Food was hit or miss... Elote was awesome - huge cob of corn with the perfect balance of flavors and a tiny bit of kick. Duck tamale was okay - it was huge, but had very little duck and the flavors were a bit muted. Pozole was delicious - flavorful, well-stocked with the ingredients described, and perfect balance of meat and fat. White sangria was okay - I'd get something else next time.  All that said, I'd return and try other dishes, and would order the elote again for sure!

H-AKb7zWk-CDFyUU6GcD1w.text: Food is great!  Service is not!    The staff appears to be more concerned about maintaining their hipster vibe instead of providing quality attention to their customers.  They were frequently sitting in booths with friends, chatting with each other at the host stand, and talking with the bartender instead of paying attention to their tables.  At one point, we saw our server sitting on the patio and took a drink from one of his friends cocktails - while we waited 10+ minutes for our second round of drinks.  The server gave attitude when someone in our party asked him to describe a dish prior to ordering.  Sad to know that the service ruined a good food experience.  I will think twice before I consider returning.

n_AFnkGwSYfoMbQr8Q5cXg.text: Chico Malo Phoenix is outstanding! Our server Joe knew what we would enjoy as he guided us through the menu. Our tongues have all kinds of flavors lingering. #SBC2017 need to come experience this Nuevo southwestern cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5vR1__IhnKe2-59L4nkVWg.text: Fabulous service, excellent atmosphere, and delicious food! Love the vibe and our server Angel was the best!! Will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1jZ0hQNnWcEzlSrJpHrBZA.text: It was hot outside today, so the AC and the cold water made everything better... but then it just made us happier and happier!!!  Even though there was an event downtown tonight, Chico Malo got us a table quickly!  We started with white sangria (holy yum!!) and then moved on to margaritas and the Paloma!  Again, DELICIOUS and strong cocktails!   I don't do cilantro, so not only did they make the guacamole without it, the quesadilla usually comes with a mole (with cilantro) on the plate. They even put that on the side for us!!!  The elote was terrific and all of the food was fast and hot! The best part about our visit though was the service!!!  As we sat at our table, multiple servers came by to check on us... even though we weren't "their" table!  Mario came by a few times and always had a huge smile and was so so helpful and friendly!  What a wonderful human to employ!  Our server, Nate, took the cake!  He was attentive and funny and friendly and he just made us feel so welcome!  He didn't miss a beat with our order or weird food needs !   Nate really made this place move from 4 to 5 stars!!  Thank you, Chico Malo, for a wonderful night!!!

8-0dvOZwMzJCcrdJZiBW5Q.text: I dig the vibe of this place! Been a few times and have not been disappointed with the food! Guacamole is delicious and a must order! If you wanna splurge, the scallops are bomb! Taco plates are tasty, but small, and that's all you get is tacos. Sides are extra. Staff has always been attentive and nice!

2jDeF9lm4zXbxWK1J-J2xg.text: GREAT food! Had the Al Pastor Tacos and it was some of the best Al Pastor I've ever had. My wife had a chimichanga which was equally great. The kitchen messed up and we didn't get our appetizer until it was brought out with our meal, however a manager immediately came over and apologized and comped the appetizer. Service was great on the whole.

3A_M7FDSj14gfF9aA0v8mg.text: Margaritas have a extra-special-secret-something that make them tasty. Agave maybe? We split the rejeno. I give them snaps for reinventing the rejeno, and switching up traditional mexican dishes. Next time I'll try the pozole.

aOkKE2ht9A98N0TzaOdcnQ.text: Would not recommend this place at all. We came in just 20 min ago, we were told it would be a 10 min wait which we were ok with. We had visited 2 other restaurants already, scouting new places. Myself as a business owner of a marketing and social media company,  and a friend of mine who is also a  business owner and client of mine, and our ladies. We were seated in the waiting area, the ladies had to use the restroom, then a few others sat next to us  waiting. A hostess brought them menus to look over but not us. Which was not a huge deal. Then we were seated 5 min later, we assessed the ac unit which was really hot in the entire establishment. When you have brick and glass windows in Az, it heats up and holds heat a lot  more than stucco. You need to turn it up in the summer. Then after we reached the table, we waited for 10 min, water was on the table, yet no server came to us. They checked on the table next to us, but not us. Now, at first some may think that this is a fluke, but we could not help but think this is due to race. A black and Asian man, a Mexican man, and two Caucasian sisters, all dressed appropriately, well spoken, and just looking for a double date night out, in this day and age, it sucks. Won't be back.

kzH4eskrR2t0b45qW0uvuQ.text: Very interesting menu. They put together some amazing dishes that work well.  We had avacado tacos and Jarinero torta. Wow, was real tasty

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CBwr1N9VcTAH5TQxhAeU7w.text: Enjoyed a great plate of short ribs last evening Mexican style. Chips and salsa were awesome.  The Mexican chocolate pudding was super good. The service was great! Highly recommend!

KECRsUqVSaniS3eM1P9MbQ.text: I came with a party of 5.  We were quoted 20 min wait.  We waited an 1.5 hours and we're never sat.  The hostess was unapologetic and not concerned.   We ended up leaving and eating cheap pizza.  Sad. 2 stars for the chips.

x7dqLmKqdx3sFiyNzGigLw.text: Great location.  Great atmosphere.  Great presentation.  The staff is truly friendly and welcoming. The food is a type of fusion of Mexican gourmet that brings out fantastically creative dishes. This is a new found treasure downtown that I hope everyone enjoys. They have great cocktails too. Visit. Enjoy. Make them them continue to wow.  All things aside, they brought us the best guacamole we've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

s121076Uws3q2ItE7VNAFg.text: Chico Malo? More like Chico BUENO! Holy hell, service here was so top notch, my friends and I kept joking that we almost felt undeserving! Lol! I guess we got forgotten for like 10 mins and asked them what's up and they immediately apologized and said first round of drinks was on the house. Then we ordered food and it was out in like 10 minutes. We ordered the chimichanga (just godly... tortilla fried to the perfect crispy crunch) green chile chicken (flavorful and came with the yummiest tortillas ever) and we ordered chips guacamole, salsa and ceviche. All wonderful! We ordered la calavera cocktail (serves 4 people). It's more drink than the pic gives it credit for! I was buzzin.  To end the night, my friends and I ordered a round of tequila shots... they bring out doubles!  hell ya! I had a great time here! I'm coming back for sure!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La Calavera Cocktail (serves 4 people). Drink served varies per night but we had the margarita and it was amazing!

epmj0RUGnevoWoOqgqVN8g.text: We were looking for a pre-game eat and after a quick Yelp-check, we stumbled upon Chico Malo. This place has a nice ambiance to it and the service was solid.   I ordered chips and salsa, as well as one of their happy hour special dishes (I can't recall the name of it). The chips and salsa were decent, though I've had better. However, for just $5, my special dish was incredible. There were a ton of different flavors on the plate, surrounding a crispy tortilla shell stuffed with purple potato.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

H4TZa_GuTlUt8jzJ8BLLTw.text: Great food, great service, great patio. No traditional Mexican food like tacos, burritos, and enchiladas. Instead they have great mixed plates, tamales, rellenos, and whole snapper. The food was delicious and the margaritas and guacamole were even better. Would come back here in a heartbeat.

Gfi9-vQ90Of7rAuS0hjPsw.text: Wow - this was good!!  No pics as we just destroyed our meals!   Salsa and Crem-cheese stuff was awesome!!!

byVHybwIO8JcY4DKt9ZAQA.text: Had dinner with a friend a few nights ago and this place is ok, with potential, but lacking in certain areas that I will detail below. Wish I could give it 2.5 stars, but c'est la vie.  The takeaway: if you want to check it out once because you are that curious and have nowhere else to go, sure. Otherwise you're better off spending a 100 dollars somewhere else.  The Good:  Drinks  Tried 4 different types of the cocktails from the menu and they were flavorful. The margarita mix they used is too sweet for my tastes, but I tend to like my drinks more on the sour side. That is, however, the only complaint I have about the drink.  The O.K.:  Food  The chips were bland, and almost off putting. If you're going to get the chips, you NEED the salsa. Try it without the Salsa at your own risk.  Got the shrimp tacos and all the toppings were good, but the shrimp were overcooked. The avocado sauce was good, but as a Mexican restaurant that should be a given, not something you get extra points for (unless it's amazing, and this wasn't that).  I wish I had the experience others did with the food.  The definitely needs improvement:  The Service. So. I don't know what to say besides a well trained staff makes the restaurant and a poorly trained staff kills it. The staff here need better training from management.  Let's start with the host. Friendly-ish is not the standard you are supposed to be welcoming. I know it's loud, but that's not my fault so don't get annoyed if you can't hear me right away. Also pro-tip, if there is a wait time longer than 30 minutes, you should immediately recommend drinks at the bar with a tab that can be transferred. I shouldn't have to ask you if those are options.  The bartender. The dude serving there mixed well enough, but his check-ins were non existent. I didn't buy more drinks because he didn't check-in often enough, and I wasn't going to struggle to flag him down.  The waitress. So my friend has a food allergy that we explicitly told the waitress. Twice. Ceviche comes and it's laying on top of avocado slices. Lucky my friend noticed before she digged in. You can kill someone by being THAT careless. Just remember that. They took the plate away and I canceled the order as I didn't want to risk the cooks just scraping the ceviche off and putting it another plate (yes, some restaurants do that), but you should either offer something complimentary for the mistake or have the manager over and apologize. I was so pissed off, I just wanted to leave immediately, but we were both too hungry.  And that's it! Enjoy at your own risk! (Joking, but seriously check your plate before you dig in)

3kknaCS3_jwivyROAajbMw.text: Incredible food, cocktails and desert. I had the diablo shrimp, 2 different cocktails and tres leche with churro. It was perfect! Best food ever

hZH7EIA8Uu2KSUmtu26l6w.text: We stopped here this evening before seeing a show at Stand-up Live. Never having been, we asked the server some questions and he gave us great suggestions. I have a tomato allergy (super hard to avoid at Mexican restaurants), but he had our guac made without it, and my meal had no tomatoes.   The tacos I got were served SO beautifully, and they were delicious! My husband got the green chili chicken and loved it. Service was quick, attentive, and helpful. After our meal, the manager came over we had a great conversation, and he bought us dessert.   We would come back here for dinner in a heartbeat. Their unique menu, fun atmosphere, and quick, friendly service are worth returning for.

vii5vMZH_qL7bwcAXFhpHQ.text: FRIED AVOCADO TACOS!! Yum! Everything I've tried here has been super good! However, I do feel the prices are a bit much. I don't think I'd go outside of Happy Hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uRsMp5im33CEkrYfjY-rlw.text: Ah-mazing food! Food is very tasty and plentiful. I ordered the Avocado tacos and they were unique and delicious!  We ordered the trio appetizer and the bean ceviche and guacamole was good! My friends ordered the green chicken Chile and it was very good. When you don't have to add any salt or pepper to a dish, it's awesome! Try the BAD BOY, you won't be disappointed.

-SMmu0Z8tMi9oXBvXm51QA.text: This is one of my favorite spots in Phoenix. Besides beautiful decor, and a wonderful location downtown, the food and drink is spectacular. When the weather is nice, I recommend sitting outside or at the bar. The staff is wonderful and they always have great recommendations. The service is extremely quick even when the restaurant is busy. The drinks are always mixed perfectly, and the food is always great. My favorite is just the classic guacamole-one of the best I've had in Phoenix. Whether you want a quiet drink or a night out with friends, this restaurant is the perfect choice!

A1yP4Qhp2IYVW0IsQ4LlFQ.text: Great date night spot! We went for a light dinner and beverages before a concert at Talking Stick Arena. Nice music, food was good, drinks were so-so, service was excellent. I think they got a bad batch of limes that day so the drinks tasted weird to us. We ordered the elote (corn w/ fixins) to share...it was delicious, but very small. I think it equaled about one ear of corn...$7 is steep for an ear of corn (and I should know because I'm an ex-Nebraskan). All in all, it's a solid date night place...the green chile chicken and corn tortillas was scrumptious.

LrCfDrS8O_SpTKytd89vhg.text: Got to say thank you. Great meal and service from Nate. Check it out. Overall presentation and prep were well done.

Db_IgNzhyAC3H2Au3YRvzg.text: Absolutely phenomenal!!! The owner went the right direction here! Delicious fusion of flavors. We were here from out of town staying at the Hyatt and happened across this place. Tops the expensive and lack of culinary imagination at The Compass Grill where we paid quadruple the price for a subpar experience. Cannot recommend this place enough! If you're in town do it you will not regret it. Spoke with the owner as well, wonderful man!

JizoOAaON7NRM9JT66Li9g.text: Fantastic tacos! We sat outside and the heat lamps did us justice. Very tasty food. Will definitely be back next time we are in Phoenix

efpkh1CP6VZxSwN1vhT_iQ.text: Great location and atmosphere! Went in for a lunch bite today, was pretty empty, but the food and service was still really good.  Got the build it yourself quesadilla and it was like a pan of melted cheese with chorizo or mushrooms in it, then a side of corn tortillas and you literally put it all together yourself... very interesting, never had it before, but was tasty (not filling).  Look forward to trying their 3 for $10 tacos next time.

41ewKIsgwacxdEUQXl3B7w.text: Joseph and Maddie are awesome! Maddie answered all our questions and Joseph even gave us a list of awesome happy hour spots ! So glad we stopped in for some small bites and the house marg(on tap and delicious) the elote and ceviche sooooo good !

drlFFzxem_f5Jtb_VCe3mg.text: 5$ for a 12 oz bottle of soda (aka no refills) 5$ each taco, my tacos were cold, very limited lunch menu.  Why would I spend my money here. Not at these prices. The taco itself wasn't bad but still small and not worth the price.

CHcKYf1yuopGUv47va8ylQ.text: Great place and even better environment!  The food was beyond amazing and they had so many different options. If you don't like the same old Mexican restaurants and want to experience something totally different... this is the spot!!!! Thanks for the great service and excellent food:)

UnSvw1E9jjToP2VWdIHMPQ.text: Such an amazing restaurant that the downtown Phoenix scene is very lucky to have. I will come regularly from old town Scottsdale to eat here over many of the Latin American restaurants around my house. All of the food and drinks were delicious and innovative. The vibe and the atmosphere of the restaurant was very modern and inviting. Some of the best acoustics I've experienced in a restaurant, place was packed and we had great conversation amongst six people. The service was fast and friendly and the owner came out to say hi which made the night. Cannot wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Padre Pepino drink. If you don&#39;t order this then you got the wrong drink.
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bolo de coco drink. If you like coconut, then you have to have this!
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool twist on nachos. The chorizo is amazing and the queso is the best thing ever. Order a side of the queso for the rest of your chips!

N6nEZ8ujLdk9pqYAyEl8Kg.text: I'm not sure i understand the negative reviews here. The food was very tasty and high quality. Yes, it isn't cheap, but you get what you pay for. If you like inventive high quality food, then eat here.

ISCBPUUtDYn0afkV2SUdpg.text: I must say, the tacos here were all very unique and tasted amazing. Probably the best tacos i have ever had. our server was really good and the drinks were top notch. only giving it a 4/5 because it was way too expensive imo. $4-$5 for a single taco is pretty ridiculous, and drinks were super expensive too. I spent over $60 on 5 tacos and 2 drinks. worth a shot to come here and try it out, but i can't justify coming here often because of the price

88-UzPB55ILl0z_EBPVI6Q.text: The BEST Mexican food I've had! The dorados de papa is to die for. Incredibly friendly and personable service. Our server was so awesome. One of the owners even came up and talked to us for a bit and was just as awesome. If you're looking for actual authentic Mexican and Latin food, this is it.

pJ4vmrB9T_2uppaw6SCINA.text: Food is good, but portions are too small for their price. I ordered two tacos and an appetizer to split with another person and was still really hungry. $5/taco with $12 app (basically 3 small tacos)

qKyBsDzn2LJBV7JMRmNiSg.text: Pass on this restaurant. Many other options for good Mexican in the area... Food is decent; inventive menu with appealing mix of flavors.  Service however, especially at the outside bar is weak.  The hipster bartenders are more interested in talking about their bro-talk than taking care of their customers. Underwhelming is an overstatement. What is the appropriate number of times for a server/ bartender to pass by their customers before they ask for their order? Or if you need anything else?

TVWrqexjOIsctnY8JNx_rg.text: Atmosphere was blase, bartender was impersonal and short with us, a server had a rude comment to say about our drink inquiry when he probably shouldn't have made any comments, and the food was subpar for the Mexican genre or even Modern Mexican or Southwest Mexican genres-- gaudy dishes without any real umph. I won't be back.

kEnvhvlT8ju2pA3VtDD3kA.text: This location needs to improve on its menu. Not a lot of variety. The staff is very nice and attentive and the location is awesome.

h-F1Uecp4uNtLlpWlUtwKw.text: While visiting Phoenix we went to Chico Malo with our group. Dinner was excellent and the location was great downtown. The indoor outdoor bar was great and the service was to notch. Guacamole tacos were were a favorite among the group!

q2pPRYn7KiUNMStgOsGX6w.text: Wow! This food was amazing! The vibe.. in sane! Local artists making the place look so sweet and hip.. and Angel.. what a great server! Well Angel made the experience a whole lot sweeter! Great new spot. Will he back!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Must try the fresh avacado dip!
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadillas &amp; Avacado tacos
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PGXBvMFHbFW3b235bUaz_w.text: I like finding new restaurants to eat at. The food was actually pretty really good and so was the service in my opinion. I remember we had a server who's name was Anahi. She was super nice and courteous. I would recommend others asking for her. I honestly am looking forward to eating their again because of the food and service!

UT4HrKfjVPVFnB1j16DZbA.text: The food was delicious! Everything was fresh and came out timely. Melissa and the rest of the staff helped us out, wonderful service. Thanks for the great experience!

sZpFBf1UyDw_P1dxMUxiNw.text: Fantastic flavors in their tacos. The chef knows very well how to meld flavors. My wife has the shrimp chievche and was absolutely delicious. The presentation of the food was great. We have found a True gem in Chico Malo!

0eMUUyI0FmO1SQ0dzsf7BA.text: Great ambience enhanced by the live DJ. Great service, delicious rib eye, great drinks! Love the decor & vibe! Will return!

FlFmfAtN_XWyeoeJuFWrig.text: First time going, my roommate introduce me to Chico malo, it was amazing. We went for food and drinks. I had a bomb cocktail called a Loma bonita they make grapefruit soda in house and used that and garnished it with a edible flower making it look beautiful like the name. I had a pork verde that melted in my mouth and came with a green sauce and tortillas my roommate had a few tacos he said the duck carnitas was his favorite along with the avocado taco. Now the look and ambiance was something out of a art show with several different art instillation throughout the building that the staff was more then willing to explain. Fun fact the light fixtures are sourced locally from HINKLEYS a local LIGHT fixture company.

nX-wYANanlCeEkoFVrlrSA.text: Im only giving this review 2 stars due to the fact that they claim to have a "happy hour menu" when the price of an item on the happy hour menu matches the price on the regular menu. I don't appreciate being deceived by the name of the menu. I brought it up to our waiter and he agreed that it was the same but were hoping no one would notice.

ON7muG6muZZ5ZgktDMwz6Q.text: I was heading to lunch and that that Chico was open, so I took a chance. I stopped in after 1, so there weren't many folks. I took a seat at the bar since I was a single. The place is new and very cool inside. Similar vibe to the Copper Blues above it.   The service was a bit slow. Again not many people at the bar so this was surprising. That said, the food I had, was really good! I had the Carne Asada taco and the Pollo Tinga taco. The presentation was very nice and each was very pleasant to look at. But the taste was even better! Both were very flavorful and the meats on both were tender and juicy. I could have eaten 3 or 4 easy. But kept it to two as the price is on the upper side for the size compared to other similar places in the downtown area nearby.   Overall, a very good experience. If you are hungry, order more than 2.  But would be a fun place at night to eat before or after the comedy club. Recommended and I'll be back.

KEk6VLMHlygDbYyQLzg-Jw.text: Went here for my friends birthday last week. High quality=high price. The tacos are delicious, the servers are attentive and personable, and the drinks are strong, fun, and affordable. Definitely worth a try, would absolutely go again. Nice place for a cocktail, a couple tacos, or just to eat their salsa which was freakin delicious and creative. Go to Chico Malo!

v1v_wsRcUd7zxa9MopxjwA.text: This place is so cool and amazing! Was a little worried since it was about 30 minute drive from resort north of the airport but worth the drive!! It is in the hip downtown area and I was instantly impressed by the decor. Very fun and lives up to its name. Started with guacamole which is so big! Seemed never ending but in a good way. Next was the shrimp diablo and al pastor tacos, which were so fresh and flavorful. They were on corn tortillas I think and were just perfect. Three in each order which was enough between 2 people. For fun we also go the street corn (off the cob) and the quesadilla. Both delicious cheesy flavors!  For drinks we just had the margs (mine with sugar rim). Thought they were great! I recommend getting reservations a week or so in advance. It's not possible earlier than that but keep an eye on opentable!

p1mQDCWiRk4NPz5RDFeFVw.text: Great location in the heart of downtown.  Walk here from church to have brunch on Sunday.  Great brunch menu food, good beers and drinks.  This is a nice spot for a downtown meal or drinks.

Qzu1Feog8XIBTBLPJMtzhA.text: Deliciousness all on one plate! I got the Barbacoa and a sangrande (in honor of Ariana Grande's concert I came out here to see with my daughter and niece). Man I was so impressed that I ate all my food; almost licked the plate! Very satisfied with the flavors and hospitality. Definitely worth coming back too. Thank you Chico Malo!

WZzlKAlp1kNRbCxxXl94zw.text: We decided to come eat at this establishment for a friends birthday. The server was very nice and attentive, she checked on our table multiple times and had a nice disposition. We order chips and guacamole. We noticed that they didn't give us salsa with the chips and when we asked they said that there is a charge for basic green or red salsa which I found strange. The guacamole was tasteless. The design was nice but the noise level was a minus. The food was tasty.   Quesadilla 4/5, Green Chile chicken 4.5/5, the lamb 3.5/5and the carne Asada 3.8/5 Service 4/5, atmosphere 4/5

dxECigIH7QQqqV_MbJUl4A.text: Not even embarrassed to admit that we went here for lunch and immediately decided to return for dinner. For lunch (technically Brunch on Sunday)  we started with the shrimp ceviche. This was not served with chips, which surprised us at first- but we quickly realized we didn't need them. The watermelon in this dish was a surprising and refreshing addition. I could have eaten 3 of these to my self. My husband and I ordered the Pozole (a Mexican soup/stew) and the Al Pastor tacos. Both were excellent, but the Pozole stole the show. The broth was INCREDIBLE. It's very filling with succulent morsels of pork and of course gooey cheese. It's served with fresh homemade tortillas that are so freaking good. I loved the pork in the tacos, great texture. We also had margaritas- which were very strong! Lol   We returned later for happy hour / dinner and sat at the bar. The happy hour menu is small, but sufficient. They only offer two wine options total (on regular menu too) and the white was a blend that was heavy on the chard (per the bartender). So I went with another marg and learned they are in fact draft margs. I was annoyed at first, but I'm sure they are homemade still- just premade! This round wasn't as strong as lunch, but still delicious. We ordered the HH appetizer shrimp ceviche tostada for another taste of that! We also ordered the vegetable tamale and the leg of lamb of dinner. We were quite full by the time the lamb came, but somehow we managed to eat most it- it was huge! And we didn't even break the bank for dinner, all very reasonably priced. 4 drinks, two apps and one entree all for about $75. Would definitely return next time we are in Phoenix.

bbRbxYGhvDtlOMgcOWStBQ.text: Food was really good, but service was really slow (despite it not being busy at all). I would return, just hope that our server would be more attentive so we can get our drinks before 20 minutes has passed.

vuylspwmM45Kb3n3JoK5Eg.text: My mind is blown! After we arrived in Phoenix, my party was feeling like a little Mexican so we headed over to Chico Malo. We arrived in the later afternoon, so we got right in and our food came fast. Our server was very friendly and personal and the ambiance was incredible. Sidenote: I want whoever did the interior work here to design my house, it was so beautiful. We ordered the Trio to start and holy-guacamole it was a good way to begin the meal. Next, we shared the diablo shrimp tacos, the al pastor tacos, and the Green Chili Chicken. All were incredible and so flavorful. The sides of the elote were also a hit and I think I'll be craving that corn for a while. It really was so delicious and lived up to the statement on their website of being unapologetically bold and flavorful. Also, the price was very reasonable for the quality of food and the ambiance. If I was local, I'd eat here regularly.  The only question I have is how do I get them to open a location in  Salt Lake City, Utah?

hvZ--VPO-s3V0T80nFwOag.text: While spending time in downtown, my son and I decided to grab a bite to eat. The weather was great. Chico Malo has an amazing outdoor space. Business wasn't busy but not dead either. We were welcomed by a friendly hostess and seated right away. Our waiter was fast at getting to us and taking our drinks down. The menu is good. I do however,  prefer to have a menu that I know what I'm eating. I chose the avocado tacos, while my son got the chimichanga. We did share the elote as an appetizer. That was amazingly gooood. Really good. My tacos were good. Not the best tacos I've had. The chimmy, was really good. Sauce was mild. I'll consider this place a stop. But will be up for trying some place new while in downtown next time.

S5pawXamT9TRCMJlClQgBA.text: Ordered Mexican style quesedias. OMG heaven. They use blue corn for their tortias. They taste heavenly. Also ordered volcano shrimp. Awesome! 5 out of 5. Their rossted pepers and roasted green tomato-based green salsa is far better than rossted red tomato-based red salsa. Their Habernero sauce is excuisite. xEKv_R5Id6XDRYKFGict7Q.text: Six of us visiting from out of town all left hungry. No chips and salsa, eclectic tiny portions. Fancy restaurant serving Mexican food, but it seems the owner has never been to Mexico, which we have many times - I've never seen food down there that looks anything like this. Steer clear if you have a teenage kid who is hungry but if you have a bird, maybe some kind of Quasi-Mexican bird, this is the place for it... presentation, the feel and vibe are great, but the taste and the portions left us all wanting. Server iterally said "we can't serve you salsa and chips (like a normal Mexican place ... I added this part) because we can't make copious amounts of salsa and just give it away." What?

kWn44yfjeOM0sgrvAbQ11w.text: I've been here a few times, and I've never been disappointed. The food is always solid, service is top notch. And I LOVE the decor. Such a unique vibe for downtown. That being said, the prices are definitely a touch high for Mexican food. Overall, I recommend it.

1VF8DnLNwjHrBinnpDvXyw.text: I was a little wary of Chico Malo after seeing some of the initial reviews.... but of course I had to see for myself. 8URwdHv43ibTQ2Tcw2Jrpg.text: I had heard from other reviews that the service at Chico Malo could be slow, so I made sure to come during a slow time, lunch on a weekday. People were still seated at the tables.  I first ordered a Cordoba Cafe, a drink I thought that was at Sips and Sweets. When I complimented Tracy, the bartender, on the drink, she said, 'Oh no that's not it!' Zach, the bartender from Sips and Sweets came out and explained to me the difference between the two drinks. The Cordoba Cafe was inspired by the traditional drinking habits of Italians. First, dine, then have an after drink. But in tune with the Mexican flavors, the fernet is sourced from Mexico, not Italy, and it's Mexican Coke in the mix as well. Most importantly for the jolt, it also features Cartel nitro coffee. I was impressed at the dedication to the authenticity of the drink, and it showed in the delicious flavors. The second drink, the one from Sips and Sweets, had burnt honey and spices in it. I encouraged Zach and Tracy to put it on the menu, it was so good that the flavors infused into the foam, amazing! Finally, my tacos came. The duck was cooked perfectly, not too crispy, and there was a pecan crunch which was new and complimentary. The pork belly was perfect, too (but how can you really mess up pork belly?), and surprisingly the crispy avocado was delectable and one of my favorites. In addition to the flavorful fare was the colorful eclectic ambience. There is an art installation of a mural made of books by JB Snyder and Tato Caraveo, and an awesome depiction of Frida when you walk in.  All in all, have to give this 5 stars for service, food and drink quality, and ambience!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NpX5AbqQOulI-V3QVvyTlw.text: Incredible service, excellent brunch options. Decor was creative and fit right in with the downtown Phoenix vibe. If they have to replace the Corner with something, this is an awesome switch!

Hkjxpa1L2GN80aVeoPmL0g.text: My new favorite place downtown. From the chicken skewers ... to the Elote! We came for dinner last night and brunch today. Highly recommended!

P22ggBoY3EREKap7UrSo7Q.text: What a fantastic addition to downtown Phoenix! I was there recently for business and had a four night stay in downtown. A chance meeting with Zach from Chico Malo at a bar changed the monotony of eating at the hotel. On my last night in town I tried Chico Malo, and it was sensational.  The food was inventive and well prepared. Shrimp ceviche was unique, fresh and fantastic. The Prime flat iron was the best beef I'd had all week! Cocktails are also a big part of the formula at Chico Malo with an extensive list of tequilas and very knowledgeable bartenders.   There was a lively crowd and the music was great, but not overpowering. I can't say enough, other than I'm so happy to have another option in downtown Phoenix!

I-bDnChzv5csNw4U3fKlrQ.text: The margarita was really good, and the short rib taco was awesome! I could have ate a bunch of them. Melissa was our server and was what made the difference from a 4 star to 5 star. We will definitely be back soon.

G-Bsm8MOmW601dKHsmJcRA.text: Very cool ambience. Love the decor and the name. I'm from Texas so I was apprehensive about ordering the chicken mole. Although it is cooked very differently than home, it was delicious. Chicken was tender and the flavor was great. This is a unique type of restaurant with the different ingredients in the plates and tacos but very well put together. I had the  corn and beans, both exceptional.

2fMjeqjo0qH_8Tlywk-JYw.text: BE AWARE THIS ISN'T MEXICAN FOOD YOUR ABUELITA WOULD MAKE.  With that warning feel free to proceed with my unbiased opinion. I went here with ZERO expectations of the type of Mexican food it would be. To start I gave it 3 stars because it is quite pricey, was the food worth it? I'm about 70% sure it was. I took my mother and aunty here for my mother's birthday. It was an early dinner, no trouble making a reservation or finding the place. We all ordered bebidas alcoholicas, at least that's what they were called on the menu. I got an alebrije, my mother got the paraiso tropical and my aunty got the sangria. I don't like the sweet stuff but they do, I loved my drink the smoky mezcal was paired perfectly with the hibiscus, lemon, ginger and basil. My mom loved her drink but she loves anything sweet and even mentioned after on FB how her drink had an exotic liqueur. My aunty said hers wasn't sweet enough the waiter was kind enough to bring her a packet of stevia and she said once that was added it was delicious. We got the tableside guac and got the standard mix but added mango, cotija cheese, pomegranates, corn and jicama. I definitely have had better guac at other places but it was nothing to complain about, still good. The chips were BOMB freshly made. I got an appetizer of mango + chile, it came with this red chile sauce and what seemed like some type of seeds and pomegranate. It was delish a nice twist on mango with chamoy. We all loved the tacos I got the short rib and duck, no complaints they were filled to the brim with ingredients and super tasty. Their mole was absolutely delicious on the short rib and duck.  I could've eaten 10 each of them but then I remembered each taco costs $5.  My mother got elote and shared it with my aunty, they love elote so there isn't much you can do to ruin it for them. The rest of the tacos ordered were the pastor, chorizo  and tinga. My mom didn't like how the chorizo had actual small circle sized potatoes she said they were too difficult to eat. Aside from that everyone including myself loved their tacos. We were too full to have dessert, I was very sad about this. The reason I gave 3 stars was ultimately the price and taco portion, for the amount of food you get you are paying a pretty penny. $5 for one small ish sized taco is A LOT. If you just order two tacos they would be more of an appetizer then a meal and I'm being generous when I say that. I get that these aren't your run of the mill tacos but if that's the case then my taste buds need to be blown away and not just reading fancy descriptions that blow me away.  Ambience is AMAZING. Waiter was PHENOMENAL. I happily paid for our near $100 meal and tipped the waiter a little over 20%. I think it's worth a try if you have an open mind and like to try new things.  Also next time I might try an entree.  People remember, this place is new so keep in mind they may have some kinks to work out. I most definitely think that it is better then 1 or 2 stars.  Maybe those low raters were expecting my grandmas chorizo tacos and believe me you're not going to find those here.

3Ok7kmif6URHybGhnmjkvg.text: Absolutely delicious, will come again. Not sure how there are reviews saying the food is "disgusting". It is far from disgusting. Yelp sucks but this place is great

Cfpqy2-BD0UOwaKAoL3LjQ.text: I was visiting from Seattle and stopped by with some friends. First impressions were great - the decor is really cool! The drinks are very well crafted with unique ingredients outside of your traditional sweet cocktails you might find elsewhere. They just opened so the service still seems to be finding itself, but they were all extremely friendly. The ribeye was one of the best ribeye I've ever had with a nice smokey flavor. The corn was also amazing. I've seen others on here complain about the pricing, but I'd suggest they go to Taco Bell if they are looking for super cheap tacos instead of the more artisan experience you're going to get here.

ZLYkNfshef7nPPDVW4W-SQ.text: Chico Malo has a really fun and young vibe, it has remarkable tacos and great salsa. I attempt to try most new places in the area and love salsa so I was pleasantly surprised when I tried this place. I have been back 3 times since then.

9Jtorl391ewGLfYUshs4-Q.text: I love guacamole!  They make it in front of you while you pick the ingredients!  The sangrias are delicious.  I haven't tried the rest of the food just stopped in real quick to get a couple drinks with friends, but I want to go back soon and get their gauc and try the tacos!

oQfjV8WcJfIwE-Z0FLIx5Q.text: Checked this place out tonight and was thoroughly impressed.  Come here with the perspective of wanting Mexican food out of the ordinary and not something to satiate you in the middle or after a night of drinking.   In terms of the environment, the decor was awesome. The murals throughout the restaurant were unique and artistic especially the bookcase in the back of the restaurant. They help to bring a sense of liveliness with a Mexican influence that is lacking in downtown Phoenix.   Service was attentive with great recommendations from our server, Ben, throughout the course of the meal. Ben provided thorough descriptions of the menu items that were unfamiliar to myself and the others in my party.   Regarding the food, my party and I had the chips and salsa, a selection of tacos, the scallop entree, and the Mexican panna cotta. The salsas all had great and distinctive flavors and were complemented from the crunch and well-seasoned tortilla chips. The roja was my favorite as it had the right bit of brightness and spice. The tacos (al pastor, baja fish, and duck carnitas) were the highlight of the night. While the tacos themselves were small, they were filling and packed with flavor, especially the duck carnitas. Each taco had the right balance of richness and acidity. The tortillas were soft and hand-made in the restaurant that helps to set them apart from other Mexican restaurants in the area. The scallops were phenomenal; they were a great size and perfectly cooked. The grits served as an accompaniment is something I would order on its own as they were delicious, luscious, and creamy. The panna cotta was the perfect ending to the dinner, light, fruity, with a little bit of spice. Overall, I came here for an experience outside of regular Mexican/Tex-Mex and was wholly satisfied.   Some of the cocktails may need a deeper explanation and/or some work on, but this place has a lot of potential especially since it has just opened so recently. I look forward to returning.

knUcSox0jlweIKddHSC6xg.text: Came here after Stand Up Live, place looks cool and with a modern Mexican style. Service was great and food came out quick. I was raised on Mexican food and this place reminded of growing up. With the chorizo and papas, I loved the food. It's different then your ordinary Mexican food. But that's okay, it's bringing you a different experience with a unique style! Try it out, food is tasty and it's a Classy joint!

wwaO0sTe7umLKSZ6KTwP4g.text: I have been to Chico Malo four times and it hasn't disappointed me yet.  I have been to this restaurant to impress friends with my new downtown Phoenix find, celebrated both my husband's  birthday and later my adult son's, and earlier this week met with two girlfriends for an evening of catching up.  The hip mural size art work on walls is part of the experience, as is the outside patio and a beautiful bar.  The food is not really traditional Mexican, but a little more modern mix of south of the boarder flavors and the salads and guac and chips were delicious.  Everyone was happy with their food choices from salads to steak and street style tacos.  My fellow diners included small groups in business attire in for after work drinks, convention attenders at a large table with name badges still attached, and friends together out on the large patio.  The staff are very attentive. Parking is in a large garage under the building off of Jefferson St.  Two hours of parking was validated on my ticket by Chico Malo.

Y2yPhKgq3Dlq3h-rxCfMOQ.text: Great ambiance and food! The music was great, happy hour prices were even better. Staff is all great and well trained! The el pastor tacos were amazing! I also tried the pork belly tacos and was pleasantly surprised at how good they were! My fave there is the chorizo app!!

7CvQVrP8rrjPcPPPJ7ZRSA.text: Chico Malo is great food and a great experience. The food is artfully designed and the atmosphere is fun and modern.  We had the table side guacamole and I have never seen more ingredients offered to give your guac the best flavor. The roasted corn and cheese added such a nice flare.   I am happy that after a D-backs game I found this great place in downtown.

_MLdZgnJ_zhIewfxK8S_iQ.text: Simply scrumptious. Get the table-side guac and elote for appetizers - best elote I've ever eaten. We tried 6 different tacos...all off-the-chain. Green salsa is a home run. Service was impeccable!

wewP57OaYo7sNekGZJowDQ.text: Went there for lunch and was surprised to find, despite them just opening up, they were out of bread for the Torta I was going to order. I ended up getting a salad, which was just okay. They do have an excellent salsa (the peanut-based one) though that stood out. This is another place where you pay a lot of money for tiny tacos (something I still can't get my head around...but my friends had a nice presentation, which is obviously required). Won't be back.

0vNRbNrye4ff2u2pX_MTKQ.text: Fantastic tacos! Don't expect a mom and pop Mexican place. It's chef-driven with high-quality ingredients. The tacos range from the more traditional carne asada to forward-thinking duck. Happy hour every day, including weekends, from 3-6. The margaritas are perfect-- not too sweet and can't be beat for $5 on HH. Plus, they have nice selection of beer. The staff was friendly, professional and offered great suggestions throughout our meal. I highly recommend Chico Malo for a great Mexican spot downtown.

Q0XsZaFWd-CBKJrg5tjZxQ.text: Had a great time, great service and great food. The ceviche on sliced avocado was great!!!

2HuywrF7Q4d-8NUKxsLZDw.text: Wow, what an awesome addition to City Scape! The food, drinks, and service were all incredible. My coworker had a food allergy and the staff was beyond accomodating for us. Peter was beyond attentive and helpful. I definitely recommend stopping by the next time you're downtown!

2kTEXz9PLadFTmfZicVFDQ.text: Okay so I don't usually do this... but holy balls Chico malo has the most amazingly flavorful food. Their elote is the most amazing thing I've ever eaten. All of their dishes are so beautiful and packed full of depth and spice. From the moment you walk into the restaurant, there is such a relaxed feel, their eclectic decor and indoor outdoor open concept layout  is so laid back and welcoming. You can truly feel the love and passion they have invested. Hector, grant and Pete were taking care of me and my friend and they were so knowledgeable and friendly. That was literally the cherry on the cake for us. Phenomenal across the board. So happy to have found my go to Latin restaurant!!!

PiSMw5OePQ_pZL22qUEm7w.text: I had high hopes for the new place...nice atmosphere but extremely overpriced for the quality of the food and service.  Don't waste your time!  Went here for lunch with friends and kinda shocked by the $4 price for tea $10 guacamole that was bland and $6 for a side of beans.  Keep the Scottsdale prices in Scottsdale unless you are bringing your A-game

RFF08ObGXxU6KM5jjbAncA.text: Excellent service and food! The table side guacamole was one of the best I've had and the margaritas were the real deal. Looking forward to going back soon!

cy80DmsjGNphQu9AlbTrBA.text: Came here with a group of four for dinner. Really liked the vibe and music! The service was pretty quick, friendly staff and the food was great. Definitely recommend the guacamole, you get to choose the ingredients and they make it in front of you. I'm not usually a big guac eater, but we finished it pretty quick because it was so good. The homemade chips went well with that and the salsa. I had three tacos: pork belly, baja fish and duck. The fish one was my favorite and the pork belly a close second. Also, the drinks are amazing. I loved the bolo de coco, had to get a second one! My wife really liked the horchata too. Highly recommend Chico Malo, we will definitely be back!

BWRFjoFLBCbfB-WV97GCqw.text: I love the atmosphere and the concept. So good for downtown. I enjoyed all the food but it's just too pricey for what you get.

d4jknQLpxDMXm2vvlBP4vA.text: Chico Malo did not disappoint. The atmosphere fits perfectly in downtown phx, beautifully planned from the murals and lighting to the servingware. Service was phenomenal. The staff were personable, attentive, and swift with our orders, food, and check. I love when a restaurant makes you feel at home! As two hungry guests, we first ordered beer (it was cold!), and the guacamole (a fun novelty, and substantial portion made from 2 whole large avocados) which was brought out with salsa and warm chips and were refilled for free later during the visit. Next came the puerco beans and 3 tacos which were served on freshly made 4-5" tortillas: The al pastor, pollo tinga, and chorizo y papas. I personally loved the unique touches on each taco...jalapeno marmalade, egg crema, pineapple...which I felt matched the artfulness of the atmosphere and the eye-catching menu design. The flavors of each were fantastic and we left with a completely quenched appetite. Would return!

CHl1pP6ZlfC8m65ntE5XBg.text: Conveniently located near convention center and sports venues. I went here for happy hour with friends and they had some great deals, including $5 margaritas. My friends are and said the food was great but I wasn't hungry for a meal yet so I just picked at chips and salsa (the smoky salsa was delicious). I did try several drinks. They had some decent beers but more importantly their spice rimmed margaritas were delicious and helped balance the drink's light sweetness. We all also got the tequila old fashion which was smoky and smooth. Definitely recommend trying this drink, it's a good sipper! The wait staff was friendly and accommodating since we asked a lot of questions, threw out a few "surprise me" when ordering drinks, and kept inviting more people to our table so they had to expand it three times...great place overall!

huoxjJKCrt9ezNa0Qxu0Ew.text: The menu is disappointing. Not much to choose from. The sangria had a funky clove flavor. Our table ordered several of what they said were there most popular dishes and we were all underwhelmed. On a good note, the waiter was very nice.

23ls91Kk3WXESRp5aWEmMg.text: Great place to get tacos in downtown Phx. Very friendly service and they offer great happy hour options.  They have a good selection of draft Mexican beers and they have authentic al pastor tacos!

NiIMEIyu5qhvJwixx-Mmag.text: Walked by this restaurant the other day & had to come back to check it out. Went there last night & for being opening night everything looks to be already running smoothly. The servers were super friendly & knowledgeable, the food options were great & the food was even better! For the quality of food and the atmosphere, the prices were spot on. All of the food came out in a timely fashion as well! Can't wait to go back for more!

vUkPeIR9XHdu8yCIW6glPg.text: My first time to Chico Malo and I will be back! I loved the artwork and overall vibe of the restaurant. The staff was friendly and kept checking on us. The Chips and salsa were fresh and I love the homemade guacamole. I ordered the Chulo salad and it was the perfect vegetarian option. Don't miss out on such an awesome spot in Downtown Phoenix!

Pz0pD8ikpkB74H8wX5QNRA.text: First off this place is the coolest place to hit in Phoenix. Andre, Ariana, teddy, grant, and Zach are the ABSOLUTE best!! Pork belly tacos are to die for. Don't miss out on this awesome spot! 10/10 would recommend

VPZOsqWUFYpmcAibOHCcqw.text: Eh, I've been excited for this place to open. The place is really nice looking but the food isn't that good. Way overpriced, even for downtown. The street taco tortilla is tiny. The ingredients don't seem to flow together and not tasty. Tried the Baja fish and Al Pastor.... I'll try it again when they're open for awhile and see if the food and flow at the place come together.  Customer service was good but you can tell they're still trying to figure things out.

4zg6dk7XzObOYRT3961-Pw.text: I'm not downtown too often, as I live a bit away. However I was able to make it down there Tuesday evening due to a concert I was attending at Comerica.  Not a lot of Spanish type food in the area, so I was pleasantly surprised when I stumbled upon Chico. The presentation of the food all the way down to the flavor was amazing. I will definitely be back, look forward to what downtown Phoenix has to offer in the upcoming future.

LYw7QgUVGN0GQPWb9K_I7A.text: Amazing decor, fun vibe, awesome staff!!!! Drinks were on point, and the management was super-hands on and visible. Expect delicious Mexican food with a unique twist. Phoenix is lucky to have you :-)

mtXWW5Iccz-xTBeSwKHINg.text: My wife and I have been anxiously awaiting the opening of Chico Malo, and our experience on the grand opening exceeded every expectation we had! They put a unique twist on the most typical Mexican dishes and knock your socks off in the process. One word: NACHOS!!!! This was definitely the first of MANY visits.

r4YkF17nQIZ81GloU20N5A.text: Incredibly overpriced for food that was nothing to write home about. Also, Chico Malo overcharged me seventy dollars for a twelve dollar meal and took nearly two weeks to refund me.

cj-37IUE_h925K_xHfJoFw.text: Delicious food, great cocktails and cool vibe!!! I had the pork verde and the bolo de coco cocktail. Sooooo freakin good!!!

qvJy_xKvb5tWDPKIDbbJUg.text: This place is in a great location and has a good atmosphere. We went. For happy hour and it was a little disappointing. There weren't many drinks to choose from and the happy hour appetizer portions were ridiculously small.

iyXUnpwh8HNz0Wb8qGQZWg.text: Absolutely overpriced and unexceptional, have limited bar that is expensive, spent over 70 bucks for me and my wife to have two tacos, 2 beers and two forced open you mixed drinks( it is not a full bar, if you want a mixed drink you have to get one of their concoctions) will never come again

mAnvU148QPi1tkxW2BAR-Q.text: Probably one of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to.  Literally have eaten everything on the menu and not one thing fell short of my expectations.  Beverages are on point.  Horchata cold brew is amazing.  Brunch / Lunch / Dinner all worth the trip downtown.

sj48Xg1a1WEVjyUsofmlvw.text: If you are a foodie, as I am, get to Chico Malo as soon as you can. This is not typical Mexican-American food. This is Mexican-South American food and it is FANTASTIC! We have dined here previously, and always have a great experience.   Fresh grapefruit juice palomas. So delicious! Fresh made tortillas. Ceviche tostada and potato taco appetizers.   Dinner was coconut rice and a duck tamale.  Best. Tamale. Ever. The masa is a light, fluffy cloud with so much incredible flavor. It melts in your mouth.   This chef layers flavors and textures into every dish. The end result is outstanding food. We will be back again and again. Highly recommend Chico Malo.

2tDCGtzSBLJbbGKhcCypww.text: My husband and I stumbled upon this restaurant when we were in town for the night. Sat at the bar and it did not disappoint! I ordered the shrimp Diablo and my husband had the quesadilla with chicken. Both were phenomenal. Bar staff was great and very engaging. GO! You will leave will a full belly and satisfied taste buds

3fevqpg95X0xBYpctI8tkQ.text: I had both of the vegetarian Tacos and the Chile mango margarita. IT WAS AMAZING! Not from here but I would come back to this place over and over again! Our waitress, Christine, was super sweet and helpful. Had a great experience!

sencSFJjBR8fZmN4hE8YcQ.text: I came here before a show and was a great start to my night. Not only was the waiter very friendly and nice he also has some great recommendations. Great vibe and terrific cocktails. I got the scallops and they were delicious! I highly recommend this restaurant.

i2a8ojrm7RHg6m9tT6Fi0g.text: Tried this place after cityskate this evening and was blown away by the service (or lack there of) and horrendous food. (update: okay emotions were high... the food was not horrendous it was very unexpectedly different.)  Without ranting, the place was very modern and hip, cool atmosphere and great location. Aside from that the rest was beyond subpar.  Out of date beer, over a month past the best by date. Food was cold in the middle and just not what was expected. That would have been fine if the server had checked on us at least once to console our feelings of discontent, but he did not.  One of our dining guests ordered a salad that came undressed, and requesting dressing went unheard. She did finally get her dressing after the rest of the table had finished their meals.  However, the restaurant was not busy at all. We counted one large party and six other tables throughout the establishment.   The service made the entire experience.  And it was not a good one at all.  Management promptly contacted me to correct the situation. I appreciate it and will try again.

968tgG7wP83Jm43iCj2dMQ.text: Great food and drinks and good service. We went for the traditional guac which was really good and really hit the spot.  For cocktails, I got the Alebrije, which went down pretty easy, but I definitely felt it later that night. GF got the Abismo Negro that tasted like a manhattan and had a much stronger hit while drinking it.   Food-wise I got the short ribs which were were so tender I could have eaten it with a spoon and tasted great. The polenta and veggies it came with felt like it could have been incorporated better with the meat. GF got the fried fish which was cooked well, but needed a little something (sauce?) to give it a bit more flavor. Overall we were pretty happy and would love to hit this place up next time we are in Scottsdale.

2kDtnBHuq3WSvpyAxQrMMw.text: Guacamole and chips was great to start with. Chimichanga was great.  Thomas was our server and did a great job.

q-W_NtLvj63n4zyU5NXF3A.text: Love this place. Going to be my new fav when I am in town. Guac and chips were spot on. Especially loved the scallops.

WksrMIrplbVyxk4aozYuxg.text: The food was great! The staff was wonderful, I'd highly recommend this restaurant. I had the al pastor tacos and they were amazing. Nice atmosphere as well.

2Tw2jZVfTUqoQnt9FQiNjA.text: Well this was a fun restaurant to visit. The wait staff was all friendly and happy to be there. There was a concert so the wait was 40 min but I think we were sat around 30ish minutes so no complaints. Everyone was just in a great mood and singing to some of the great songs that they were playing as they were walking by. We had four in our party, ordered the white sangria, red sangria, sprite (comes in a very tall glass bottle), chimi, trio dip, plain cheese quesadilla, green chicken Chile and the veggie skewers. The white sangria was the better of the two with pineapple as the fruit while the other had apples. Ive had better sangria for a better price ($11 a glass) is steep for the small wine glass you get that's mostly filled with fruit. The chimi was delicious and comes with guac. The portion size and presentation were great. The veggie skewers were sadly just green and yellow squash, not other veggies. They come with the cotija cheese on it and  a unique sauce on the side (which isn't mentioned in the description). Quesadilla was also good (hard to mess up), the green chili was a great portion, it wasn't spicy to me but was flavorful. Some of the chicken appeared to be a little over cooked as it was very chewy but overall it is something I would order again. The chip trio was bean ceviche, guac and salsa. They only gave us one spoon so we had to pour it onto our plates so it became messy. The guac and salsa were good, the bean ceviche is different. Not a huge fan of black eyed peas and they seemed to take up a lot of the mixture. The bill was $85 and while nothing stuck out to us that we would have to each again, the menu has many options so we will def be back to try more things. I like that they did offer ice water when waiting for our table ( it's over 100 degrees out and everyone was sweating to death), but I wish they would've refilled our chips. With four adults and one small bowl having a refill would be nice (Chips and salsa is $3 but the trio is $12). The decor is beautiful from the giant door you walk into, to the booths to the light fixtures, just WOW.

kZZZ-670jiVxYlsC_H-pIQ.text: This place has a sports bar atmosphere and service style, with above-sports-bar prices. However, if you're willing to accept those terms, it's a good place with creative food. The lamb shank that I ordered was beautifully cooked and served on some amazingly delicious pilaf-y stuff that was full of slightly crunchy nopalitos. The sangria was also tasty. Would recommend.

kiUI5Sz2rh9jeWu9lXi-gw.text: Outstanding selection of food options and everything we picked was awesome. The trio appetizer was on point and it was nice to be able to get the guacamole without onions. My wife got the steak  dish and I got the green Chile chicken and we shared and neither disappointed. Corn off the cob street style was a a perfect addition. Best place I have eaten during business trip in Phoenix

2AHBfmhSnnh0NmVUcxydmg.text: Everything was wonderful here. The food, patio setting, and service were excellent. Best guacamole I've had in years.

1_fvOHZEhydr_6F5Ge0PZg.text: This place is a bit pricey but worth it! The food is amazing and the drinks are fantastic. The service is also very fast paced and so far I can say the waitress/waiters are always on top of the customers requests in a quick manner. Second time I've been here and so far so good!

E79qppJeg-rZ990LA_n2OA.text: Yelp took down my 5 star review for some reason. They must have thought I was a bot or something because I had no complaints. (I also don't see my 5-star review of Welcome Diner anymore, so maybe they took that down too. Ha.) Anyway that might explain why there aren't more glowing reviews if legitimate 5 star reviews are getting pulled. Evidently opinion is divided on Chico Malo. I can only speak for myself and the four friends I went with. We ordered a ton of dishes and thought literally everything we tried was bomb. The pork verde was one of my new favorite meals, period. We also met the owners and they were super friendly, which is why I'm bothering with a review when I don't usually do that.  As a Glendale native I feel like I know my Mexican food pretty well. I grew up on Pedro's, Rosita's, and Carolina's. This stuff is a little different. Fancier, more up-market, more experimental and creative. I'd put it in a category with Gallo Blanco or Richardsons / Rokerij. Great for a date or a night out.  If it'll make Yelp happy I'll give a criticism: the menu isn't super baby-friendly, according to my friends who brought their toddler, since it's rather spicy. So if you've got a baby in tow, maybe keep that in mind. But if like me you are happy to have a higher-end option for Mexican fare and drinks downtown, I think you'll dig this place.

Kk9Qub1fy9cZNaGucvC6bA.text: Came for lunch. Nice clean place, friendly staff...but food was a disappointment and prices were outrageous. Ex: a CAN of Diet Coke was $3.00!  After chips and salsa, a can of Diet Coke, and a plate of carne (about 6-8 ounces) my bill after tip was over $30!    The food was a bit bland. Expected the carne asada to be amazing at $19 and I left half on the plate. Very gross.   Go to Chipotle across the walkway and save $20.

WwPdOMEqokzVFUc7JfGgew.text: We were staying near the convention center for a volleyball tournament and we're looking for a comfortable restaurant with good food nearby. We were pleasantly surprised by the authentic Mexico City cuisine. The service, the flavors, atmosphere, the cocktails were all original and delicious.   I highly recommend this convenient restaurant. The chicken Verde and guacamole were outstanding.

Om8Qd44oDCAFnvqA4Qa3nQ.text: Amazing food, delicious cocktails, fun and exceptional service! Went here before the JLo concert and it was the perfect start to a night out!

bWbH9jSqeeCFxq4O2LoBMA.text: I met up with some friends here before a concert one night at Talking Stick arena.  When I walked in the place had great ambiance and was bustling with activity.  very cool vibe all around.  Normally i'm always a little skeptical of fancy Mexican food, since I like my Mexican food to come with rice and beans slopped on a plate next to something that looks like it's been deep fried 4 times before doused in gallons of red and or green sauce. However, with that being said, this place delivers on the fancy as well as being just absolutely freaking delicious.  I ordered the new mexico enchilada with a side of coconut lime rice.  Holy cow were both of these things slap yo mama good!  The enchilada was stuffed full of cheese, onions, different veggies and for 9 bucks a hell of a deal.  The rice was also seasoned perfectly and had the perfect light and fluffy consistency you want from a good rice.    I would absolutely go back here to enjoy their other menu items when not pressed for time to be at a concert.  highly recommend

6L_iZMqp0T7opf2aZhXmLw.text: Chico Malo was one of the places that I was a huge skeptic of but I must admit, I came out relatively surprised at how much I liked it. Located downtown in the midst of everything 'busy', (i.e sports events; concerts; etc.). I had passed Chico Malo always thinking , "Meh. It's gonna be one of 'THOSE places', that has pricing based on the hype of an event and not much to warrant on it's food'. Well. I ate my words the other evening when my husband had made reservations at Chico Malo prior to the Justin Timberlake concert. We arrived about 5 minutes late due to our Uber being stuck in the boggle of both rush hour weekday traffic and the madness of concert goers ready to flood the pre-gaming events downtown, but the hostess was friendly and thankfully, held our reservation. We had a great booth/high table that faced the bar and out towards the street for good people watching. Our waiter had water to us in no time; drinks a few moments later. They have a unique drink menu with some great looking margaritas and some great beers, if that is how you go. My husband is a beer guy; I am a wine girl.. and that sort of 'lacks' with no wine list here. I stuck with a $8 cava despite wanting to really try one of those fresh looking margs, I knew that the night was young and tequila may not be the best idea! Maybe on a later date! I asked about Happy Hour and our waiter said it was over, (our res was for 1700 and mind you it was 1715 when I asked; It says that the happy hour goes until 1800, so I am not sure if this was due to the concert? BUT, this is the part of downtown restaurants that truly frustrates me. Keep it on the real and don't gouge.) I did like that our waiter was friendly and said we should come back and taste some of the tequilas when we spoke about some of our favorites from Mexico that we like to bring back but how we didn't feel like that was the vibe , ( or wise!), for tonight! He also recommended the Trio to start and how to change it up due to an ingredient in the Hummus , (part of the orginal 'trio' selection) that I am allergic to. Loved the salsas and the guac. The chips were tasty and nice and crisp. I had to order the Pan Seared Snapper, which comes whole. It's rare to see that here in AZ, but I do love having it in Mexico! The presentation was amazing! I highly recommend this dish if you are any sort of a seafood lover! Our waiter warned it was a little salty for some, but I found it to be perfect and the right blend of flavors and spice. He told us of the chef changing it up and his history as a once sushi chef and how he loves making the dish and 'playing with its flavors'. Love that in a chef! My husband had the Relleno, which was a fat Poblano filled with cheeses, squash, veggies, crema and the right amount of spices for a perfect taste to the palate. I can honestly say the dishes truly impressed us. On this night there was a DJ popping out JT tunes and it was loud for a Tuesday early evening, but considering, it made for a fun vibe. I didn't really care for the fact that some guy, not our waiter, came to collect our plates and asked if we were ready for the check, (no we wanted one more drink, but thanks.), when we had literally been here just about an hour. All in all its a great place, with a great hip vibe in a great area for the downtown. NOW, if we return and these things happen again, I may not be so ready to repeat, but I do love that I wasn't expecting great and we had it , that is, FOR the most part;  especially for a venue downtown. But as it is said.. there is always room for improvement , just a tad, in this case, on the service scale. :-)  PS, I do recommend reserving in advance when there are events downtown!

44YWDYMHMJLqgnaCjnbGCA.text: Ordered the shrimp diablo and carne asada served with blue corn tortillas. Each had their own toppings to build your own tacos. My favorite was the skirt steak. The salsa verde and chips were tasty. The service was really good and our waitress was friendly. The atmosphere was really cool.

I5Yi6L6FWO_M3g4c6R2gUg.text: A party of 15 and we ended up adding another 6 people later on in the evening. Our waiter was very accommodating and on top of our orders. The restaurant had a chill low key vibe.   We all started with drinks and a few apps. I had the white pineapple sangria and others had their mango chile drinks and mezcal cocktails. For the table we ordered the elote and requested the corn be cut off the cob, the trio platter of guac, salsa and a bean salsa. All the items were tasty, I esp loved the salsa...it was mild but flavorful. I love corn so the elote was also my favorite.  For our main dish, I ordered the chimichanga and a friend of mine ordered the relleno. Both dishes were so tasty! The chimi was so crispy and the sauces all combined perfectly.  Def added to our places to head back. We all enjoyed the drinks and eats
