Lu5darSB4hTb-vzt0BH8SA.text: Food was pretty good, service was good. Three of us had puerco verdes and it was delicious. The tortillas are blue corn and are made on site. We noticed other tables all were getting chips and salsa and we didn't, not sure if they ordered it or it was complimentary? We did get the queso fundido as an app and it was delicious.  Serving sizes are not big, but the food is good. We had two church music beers which were really good and some sort of spicy jalapeno margarita, which wasn't that good, but I think it was my fault for ordering something I wouldn't like.

RY_MnBAkJ_g38quCZivHbQ.text: It's definitely better than a 3- maybe not quite a 4 being critical. It's a very cool trendy place serving somewhat upscale Mexican food like duck tacos. The portions aren't huge or as delicious as a hole in the wall place but the location is great downtown as it's by a lot of great bars like Copper Blues. I'm relatively picky about margaritas and got a few skinny's here which I wouldn't say are the best ever but pretty good I think- if you squeeze an extra lime in. The chips are fine but I wish they took half the mountain of salt they put on their margaritas and put it on their chips as they were pretty bland. I do love that they'll serve green or red salsa - I love the green and they give you plenty of guacamole which I appreciate in a restaurant!

GQtr16vbb1QTD7_YqDvj5Q.text: Stopped in for a couple beers before heading to Stand Up Live the other night and was pleasantly surprised! I work down the street so I have walked by this place many times and am glad we checked it out. The hosts were very nice as they guided us to the bar. I was very impressed by the bartending skills and cocktails they offer! We didn't order food this time but we will next time. Any place with Elote dip on the menu is somewhere I want to be!

-on0EZpIcSacKZLR1vaQrg.text: Introduction: So I was introduced here from a girl at the front desk of the Hotel I stayed at. So yes, this would make this my first time experience. I need to go back to thank this girl for her recommendation.  Here's Porque!  Customer service: 5/5 Honestly, I've had some amazing service, but I must say, EXCEPTIONAL service can not get better than this.  Our server Brendon was beyond OUTSTANDING, I can't find a word to describe the experience.    He was accommodating, patience and most importantly, super cool.  I messed up and ordered two sodas so Brendon picked one up for me, he totally didn't have to do that, but he did.  Even one of the head manager Peter came by to introduce himself.  All I can say is WOW!  Quality: 5/5 This is probably the tastiest Rib Eye steak I've ever had.  It was tender, juicy and omg! full of taste (highest quality taste).  The corn, dessert and salad was all equally outstanding.    Quantity: 5/5 Super generous and humungous portions.  But guess what? I ate them all cause everything was so good.  Atmosphere: 5/5 Absolutely cozy, perfect temperature and perfect music in volume. You can actually hear each other and enjoy the music at the same time.  Price: 5/5 My usual rule, quality food plus outstanding service equals PRICELESS!   Tips: If you enjoy spicy like myself, you can get Habanero sauce on the side. It makes a perfect combination with the salsa. By the way, Brendon brought it to me voluntarily without me having to ask. What a way to finish my night after a long day.   This is a MUST STOP place next time I am here in Phoenix. Thank you for the great experience Brandon and Peter.

x6m3ag1NvV-oW4_n_b3ESQ.text: I will say that the decor of this place is so polished that I thought this was a chain restaurant, I was pleased to find out it was not.  My father came to visit and was staying at the Renaissance not too far from this place so we walked over to see what they were about.  Back to the decor, it feels like a very modern Mexican restaurant and the layout is layered, as you get further from the bar the nicer it gets. I'm assuming on a busy night this place is poppin.  My Dad and I decided to get the trio for an appetizer, which had guacamole, salsa and a three bean ceviche. All three were pretty good.   For an entree my Dad got a breakfast thing, he really liked it. I had the pozole which is good but I compare every pozole in Phoenix to The Vig and The Vig still has the best pozole in my opinion.  This is definitely a spot I'll return to if I'm ever in downtown again.

8qvPeSXLQJGkYGqhD0zDXA.text: While staying in downtown Phoenix for a conference recently, I found myself at Chico Malo two nights in a row (as this was a convenient walk from the downtown hotels near the convention center).  Depending on your group size, I definitely recommend reservations.  Both evenings we were seated immediately with the reservation (one night a party of 10, then 12!). The service was great both times - the staff provided on-point recommendations for beverages, appetizers and entrees.  The Chimichanga was a popular order - and is served extra crispy!  I had the charred cauliflower one night, and carne asada the second evening - both of these entrees were part of their "make your own taco" (my words) portion of the menu and are served with fresh tortillas.

qBaMExFVhs9kl2biXmf6Tg.text: Really enjoyed Chico Malo. The decor was inviting with plenty of seating options. The menu is actually pretty simple which was great since the venue is actually quite large. We arrived on a Saturday around 9:30 and was surprised to see it so empty. We were greeted and seated quickly so that was nice for sure. Our sever was a ball of energy which really helped left up the mood for sure. We wanted cocktails and may a little snack. As we ordered our server Mario shared his thoughts on our selections which made our choices even better. My house margarita was good but lacked a little in the lime department, the other was a Mango y Chile. The Mango y Chile was perfect not to sweet. The cocktails had one thing in common you could taste the ingredients as advertised. Nice! We just ordered the Guacamole and chips. Chips were not that great but the Guac was amazing. Cleaned the bowl. Great spot for a larger group and when the weather is perfect the patio is a cool option. Mario made our visit! Ask for Mario but be ready for energy!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guac, Mango y Chile

153JuApIH8arKDVr7iV4-A.text: Stopped by this place before a show upstairs at Stand Up Live. Let Peter know that we were on a bit of a time crunch to make the show and he made sure everything went smooth and fast. Asked for some recommendations and couldn't have been happier with the food and drinks he suggested, especially the duck tamales! Great food, even better service. Looking forward to going back soon.

lyuCrtLS6vJd0KoFOLiSsQ.text: Amazing presentation! Wanted to have dinner close to the Comercia Theater, so we chose this place. My friend ordered the Diablo Shrimp. They looked fantastic, but my friend said there were so many flavors it was hard to concentrate on one. I enjoyed the chicken verde even though it was my second choice. Originally, I ordered the Chili Colorado but at 5 p.m. they were out.  The chicken verde was bursting with flavor and is delivered in a stew type concoction. It's accompanied by tortillas and shredded cabbage, pepper mix. We loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Diablo Shrimp
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Verde

rP7-01B0-yqT-3UQ_kIAtQ.text: We stopped at Chico Malo while in Phoenix last week. I wanted a little nourishment to keep me going until a late dinner we had planned. While I order wine, my lady selected the margarita - she loved it.  Next we opted for Pork Tacos and Chips with Shrimp Ceviche. The Pork Tacos were scrumptious. I would order again. Our chips were fresh and the Ceviche included tasty shrimp, watermelon, onion, radish, avocado and lime.    Service was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rFRs6XP5HZQkiH7q7h69-Q.text: I didn't actually make it in to this place to be able to try the food or drinks. I was denied by the hostess on the way in. I stopped by with a group of 6 around 2:40 on Saturday. I asked for a table and was informed that it would be an hour wait. We heard the drinks were good so we decided we could wait at the bar while we waited for a table. The hostess told us that we should basically leave because the bar was filling up. I couldn't believe my ears. What kind of establishment wants to deny a quick cashout at the bar? I made a comment to my group that they didn't want us there and the hostess rolled her eyes at us. How do people like this get jobs? I have never been denied service to a bar. It really blows my mind. Their loss though, we went to copper blues instead and had a great time. Management should really reevaluate their hostess customer service skills. We will all never come back

1urWV1KndvF2yi9jspVaOQ.text: I've been hankering to try this place, but unfortunately every time I have been downtown for an event, it's packed!   I finally was able to meet friends here for brunch and now I fully understand why there's always a crowd.  The brunch menu, has a little bit of everything, from Mexican inspired breakfast to just egg dishes. I ordered the frittata luchador (pictured below). It was a hearty portion, though I wish more of the verde sauce was added. The flavors were excellent.   My only complaint is chips and salsa aren't provided, they are extra. However, along with the guac, they were worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GlZzqbsEp_EpUfDHQFYiww.text: Service and the atmosphere were really nice.  Margaritas were great but the food was underwhelming.  We went with some friends for dinner and were able to try 6 different dishes from all sections of the menu (including the couple of items that the waiter strongly recommended - carne asada and the pork).  Expected the high prices given the area but felt like everything just needed to be kicked up flavor wise.

26vmJSZbUfrONfL6_JcAoA.text: Hard not to love this place! Fast service, reasonable prices, good tacos, nice bar. This place is a good option for lunch or HH, if you're downtown. I recommend the pastor with the house habanero salsa! PS, WiFi sucks!

ZtVBAqQnqW1BveW2Fe148A.text: Chico Malo was amazing! I was there last week with a large business group. Waiter was very helpful, accurate, and speedy. Quality of food was amazing. I had the papas con chorizo as an appetizer and I had the Chile Colorado and my entree. Highly recommend Chico Malo!

nhiFMjbTgo8TkTmHp167eQ.text: Two coworkers and I had a great experience here.  The hostess was promt and courteous.  The staff was very helpful with the menu (it's not your run of the mill Mexican food items) and the drinks were great.    The food was an adventure.  As I stated before, it's not run of the mill Mexican food, and the chef and cook staff did an amazing job blending flavors and ingredients that I've never seen and/or heard of.  You get what you pay for and it's worth it.  The decor is gorgeous, with just the right mixture of high end and edgy to it.   I've already chosen the restaurant to be a good location for business lunch and social hour, with the agreement of my coworkers that this is a great place to bring other co-workers and consultants.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not your ordinary book shelf
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View into the kitchen
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried horchata donuts with in house-made marshmallows.  Lick the plate good (I restrained myself).

37iXsE6UIdTJppV--d4DRw.text: Sat outside and dinner was great. Had the shrimp quesadillas and a spicy margarita (not on menu). Great location for those staying around the convention center.

8cDfrKPGf7DMpuLV-RjM2w.text: We had several things and shared them. Service was ok, not the best attention. The food was bland. We all said either something was ok or not goood.  Nothing we get did anyone say wow.  Lots of other options downtown

FHxDYtR0uquuxG4io4Msgw.text: First time eating at Chico malo and truly enjoyed the experience. Our waitress Desiree outdid herself with exceptional customer service. The food and drinks were delicious

9C38EmVRx057o5hb2rFS_A.text: Had some of the best el pastor tacos that I've ever had. Could be the homemade tortillas, or could be fate. I'm sure everything else on the menu is delicious, but definitely go for the Tomahawk for two. The 40 oz. ribeye bone makes a great gift to bring home to your furry friend after they've been waiting anxiously for your dinner date to come to an end.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VYLQTvgSlNxOCk3ofPL35g.text: Came back for my second time and loved it just as much. I love the patio and the downtown feel . I ate the pork belly tacos and chicken tinga taco. Once again it was really good!  Our waiter was really nice and welcoming. It's becoming my fav place!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3DvHtfLSdlVB9KiNb3cMCQ.text: 3 for $10 tacos at lunch is LIFE! At dinner order the Scallops and thank me later. The service is great and you can't go wrong with a Margarita. Plus they have fresher squeezed EVERYTHING! With a great atmosphere and convenient location at City Scape it's the best place to check out Downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zreYNIfbgX5lTNTr5neiEA.text: I went with a group of folks from a conference in downtown Phoenix and was told "We're going to a Mexican restaurant."  That wasn't exactly a lie, but calling Chico Malo "a Mexican restaurant" is like calling an iPhone a calculator.  First, it took a while to take in the whole menu - so many varieties of food, each with every single ingredient listed.  I ordered the diablo shrimp tacos, which were tasty, plump shrimp in light soft tortilla tacos, a little bit of spice and crunchy shreds of cabbage and some smooth avocado.  There was also some huge plate of chips mixed with all kinds of goodies that kept getting passed around - I didn't order it, but I ate more than my share.  This appears to be a fancy place from the looks of it, and the food is really good, but don't be fooled if someone calls it just "a Mexican restaurant."  It's much more than that.

-6Hmjf9ahShHfkPYS0bunw.text: Super delicious, especially the Duck Tamale. That mole sauce was one of the better ones I've had. The tacos were good, but surprisingly not the highlight. Ask for Elote for sure! Food: 8/10 (The highlight for sure!) Service: 7/10 (Friendly but kinda weird) Ambiance: 6/10 (Music was amazing but they didn't ask us if we wanted to sit indoors or outdoors, they just sat us outside).  Cocktails: 4/10 (The Sangria and my friend's drinks were both eh) Wait: 10/10 (No wait on a Friday evening around 8ish)  Overall a great experience and I'd be back!

qbi1HrkVL2l6bUlsHT3a-Q.text: Excellent, and delicious. In my second visit I'm now certain this is how food tastes in heaven.  Melissa, thanks for your great service this evening...

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

T_FeZUsAYha7ze08o1AjFg.text: This place is really good.  Especially before a comedy show.  Food is on point and truly authentic with some real nice touches.  I had the Chile Colorado with Home made corn tortillas and it was on point.  We also had the poodle which was good but need more hominy but did have plenty of meat and was a little greasy.  The guacamole Isaac also good. Drinks are alright and a little above price but overall definitely a good atmosphere and deserves a strong 4 star.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AaC6IqPXyfJ3AZ-4q93adQ.text: Wow! For being an upscale Mexican restaurant we where very surprised at the service we received. We went in with a party of 11 yeah big group but they normally take care of big groups better...not here. We first got there we where the last to arrive and our waiter came and took our drink order came back with everyone else's drinks except ours ok that's fine they were here before us and ordered first. But like 10 minutes later we get our drinks. But then we ordered food got another round of drinks came quicker ok all is well. Nope! We get our food everyone except one so we all waited about 5-10 minutes until he told us to eat so our food isn't cold then waiter came over and was like it'll be out soon then another waitress came over asked what he ordered and said it'll be out soon. What! Then 20 minutes later his food came we are all done eating he ate a bit then asked to be boxed up he was ready to leave.  The manager came over apologized and said that they never told them about the convention that we are in town for so he's not staffed properly. But there where empty tables in there it wasn't packed so I dunno. Food was to fancy for a good Mexican experience, Mexican is not fancy its just good and messy!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili Colorado - hard to eat because it&#39;s a burrito tortilla in there and you get no plate?
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck tamale

wESDg38UBVOIMmNGEFOXsw.text: Recommendation from concierge at our hotel. Certainly a lively place with a fun vibe! Waiter maybe a little bit too "sassy" for his own good. At his recommendation we started with the Trio appetizer. The guacamole and red salsa were both very bland and disappointing. Only the hummus stood out. For main course we shared the pork verde - pork ribs, tomatillo chile, and blue corn tortillas. The dish was fine, lots of meat, but not spectacular. $11 margaritas were nothing to write home about. Wine lovers will be disappointed by the very limited offerings.

vmfyATBRKWu1VOfhcNA8vQ.text: Visited for lunch on a Saturday and sat at the bar. They were pretty busy and I noticed that night that they seemed to REALLY be the place to be. The tacos al pastor were good but I'm partial to my brother-in-law's. ;) Still delicious as well as the McFate Hatch Chili Gatos Ale!

JQg--CsEtio-DxUZyGvI9g.text: Drinks were horrible and certainly more juice and soda than alcohol. The service, by Thomas, wasn't much better. Thomas' tone was condescending as if I was incapable of basic comprehension. The manager we spoke with did the opposite of everything a manager should do. Instead of stepping in and finding an immediate way to resolve the concerns, the manager took the same tone and only after debating the issue for several minutes and  wasting everyone's time, did he decide to do the right thing and resolve the issue- AND this back and forth with the manager happened twice. The way Thomas and the manager decided to interact with me cemented my decision to file a complaint and tell everyone I know not to patronize this establishment. It's abundantly clear that customer service & unconscious bias trainings have never been completed at Chico Malo. There are a number of restaurants in the area, please save yourself and choose another restaurant and bar, especially if you favor a strong drink and a great customer experience!

uJXbQ2ZSQi3QOqXWLEniPQ.text: Went here with some friends before we started our night out in downtown. To set the stage my wife is a first generation Mexican American so we know (or at the very least think we knowgood Mexican food) all that to say it was amazing. My wife enjoyed the ceviche and I had the elote (corn for you non arizonians). I also ordered the vegetables and loved everything (our friends enjoyed my vegetables a lot as well.) Our friends ordered a salad and the pastor and I think they enjoyed it but it was gone fairly quickly. For those of you looking for a unique take on Mexican cuisine (let's face it we all like change) this is it. You won't be disappointed

YfmKMfCn2XEKU6VnUyee0Q.text: This place is awesome! Great Mexican food with a little South American flare; interesting cocktail menu with some delicious drinks; the design and ambiance was amazing!  The roasted corn and nachos for an appetizer were not at all what I expected, but in a good way! I have no idea how to explain them, you'll just have to go see for yourself. I also had the carne asada and duck tacos and they were amazing too. I didn't believe them that the margaritas on tap were fresh, but after one sip I stood corrected. I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the food and cocktails!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You can watch your tortillas being made fresh!
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome artwork by the entrance.

z9cDZ0JohZmiqgrdoCJsJw.text: If you're going to splurge this is the place to do it. The ambiance. The location. The energy. So edgy. The food my goodness was so delicious It felt like they had a real Nana from Mexico in the back cooking. lol I'm dead serious. The beans and rice have so much flavor. OMG! The corn tortilla quesadilla with Monterey Jack cheese. Yum!!!! I'm a vegetarian so I'm not sure how the meat tastes. lol So bomb. I love it here!!

c3fFSs4rPyEkXf0VOnCqHg.text: First time trying this place out and it's great! Decor is super pretty, drinks are divine and the food is good. Andre, our server was helpful and laid back, no pressure to order in a rush.   Tried street tacos, elote and lots of cocktails! Good little spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The padre pepino!
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Nl66HY94v_i9C4e3Qzcyng.text: A True hidden gem. This place is amazing. The food was terrific and our waiter Nate really took the time to talk about the menu and restaurant history. He looks exactly like Sean Penn during the good years too! When you come, be sure to try the doraditos. They are like stuffed small potatoes. Never tasted anything like it. We also had carne asada and achiote half chicken. Just incredible.  You won't be disappointed! Park in the building as they validate.

BWorUzxAYyv7kwCzNV9YXQ.text: Came here on a Friday night with my wife, looking to eat some flavorful Mexican food. They were busy so we had to wait 10mins. The ambiance in the restaurant was chill. We finally got seated and I ordered some chips and salsa and the Puerco Verde. I don't usually eat pork but they claim that it was an award winner. Sadly I believed it. Pork is usually flavorful and that's what I was expecting but that wasn't the case. The pork was pretty bland but it did fall of the bone. It wasn't worth the 26 bucks.   However, the customer service was great. Both the host and server were friendly and offered recommendations.

uXRRIr91tj0LLLKrnoFSgA.text: The place is beautifully decorated. Interior design is amazing. The servers are also very presentable and the wait time is not long at all. 5 stars for customer service.  However, we were both underwhelmed with the flavor of the food. Everything seemed overhyped. The presentation was wonderful. But i feel like it had taken away from the actual essence of the flavor.  We had Chile verde: the sauce tasted fresh but a bit on the acidic side for me.   I got the chille relleno; it wasn't bad but it's not the best I've had.   My husband got the pork verde. The meat was cooked beautifully but, it was very shy of flavor. When you say Mexican food I'm thinking of explosion of flavor in my mouth.   My favorite was the drink. I had the coconut something. Forgot the actual name but it was the highlight of my dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips with Salsa Verde
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

otGSKC47RoA9QjZvLU7AMA.text: Picked up lunch to-go for a work meeting. The staff was really friendly, boxed everything up nicely and even separated the hot and cold dishes. Chopped salad was good, loved the hummus with cucumbers (+$2, but they give you a nice size serving, freshly sliced). I wasn't a fan of the cauliflower, but others in the group seemed to like it ok. Love that they serve Topo Chico!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chico Chopped Salad

v9DfcfEXXVfw9BrN6jHA4w.text: I LOVED everything about my Mother's Day brunch with Chico Malo. For one, they weren't crazy busy. We'd reserved for 8 and they sat us outside on the terrace area... it was such a perfect day outside. Couldn't have been better. Our server was awesome, brought me a FREE Mother's Day shot of reposado- which was glorious... Thank you!! And then of course was the food!  My daughter ordered the French Toast... the description is mouth watering... apparently this runs out so before you set your sights on it, make sure to ask if they still have some. Apparently we grabbed the last one which we were so glad about!! They were ABSOLUTELY delicious!!!   I enjoyed the Benedict. It was quite tasty.   My brother enjoyed the pork green Chile and it was SO GOOD as well.  And my boyfriend probably had the most savory... he ordered the steak with eggs. That steak flavor..... OH MYYYYYY. Although it's a very small amount of steak they give you, it is so tender and bursting with flavor - like it's been marinated for hours upon hours. It was so damn good.   The margarita is strong but doesn't seem to be - I had two and was certainly feeling them!   Overall an excellent experience. We loved it. Food and service. Thank you, Chico Malo!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Simple breakfast - those potatoes though!
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Toasting our delicious drinks!

MSxWak38A0KurU1k0_oAQA.text: This place should be called Chico Bueno.... They're good!! I mean it. Their margaritas are good, salsa, chips, pozole, ambiance, chicharrones, chilaquiles,.service, menu... It's all good. This place for us was the oasis in the middle of the desert. It was the treat that saved the day. This place is pretty cool. Totally good. Totally recommended!

N6N_qcTiM-zdPwI0wMoTUw.text: Great ambiance...cool industrial design with some urban art accents and there are plenty of seats. There's an outdoor patio area, the bar top is spacious, and there's a party room in the back.     The bartender was attentive. She checked in multiple times with me while I was there so the customer service was pretty good. It didn't take too long for me to order or for me to receive my food.  I ordered the Diablo Shrimp, which was I was skeptical about at first because I never had noples before and was unsure what it would taste like. But the bartender assured me that the dish is pretty popular so I went with it. It came out as a destruction dish with the tortilla on the side. The dish was composed of shrimps, heirloom potatoes, noples, charred avocado, and aguachile. Overall the entree was pretty good, plenty of flavors and well balanced.    I also ordered a drink, the Oaxacan. It was a standard old fashioned with mezcal. It was smokey but nothing really special.   Chico Malo is a great spot to come and grab a bite if you're in the area near Talking Stick Arena. It's close to the light rail and also close to other great establishments in the Cityscape area.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View from the bar
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Diablo Shrimp and the Oaxacan

GE1uyVHrMphtw6z1ZR38Hg.text: BEST ELOTE EVER! We stumbled into Chico Malo while trying to kill sometime before a flight and thank goodness we landed here! Justin and Hunter were awesome along with the rest of the staff and the food was delicious!

PSVB2szQlyugqr2CoYbLTQ.text: After the Boston Red Sox's VS D-Backs game I needed a cocktail. This place is located not too far from the Chase stadium and I had noticed it from my adventures at Gypsy Bar right next door.  The weather was amazing that day so we happily sat outside in the patio. We kept it relatively simple as we had eaten a big meal at the game. We ordered some chips and guacamole. The guacamole was moderately chunky and the flavor was was spot on. I was a little disappointed that the chips weren't homemade but they were crispy and the salt balance ratio was to my liking.   I ordered a spicy mango martini which was a total gamble for me as I am not a lover of things spicy. Don't judge me I'm a bit of a punk when it comes to spices. The martini had a little jalapeno kick at the end but it wasn't overwhelming. As backup my boyfriend ordered a grapefruit and ginger cocktail just in case I didn't like my drink and made him switch lol. Lucky for him I loved my martini and he was satisfied with his cocktail.  They were a bit short handed that day but our server was working his butt off and way still very attentive to our needs and even made some time for short talk.  All and all I will go back and recommend this place to others!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front sign
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips with Tradicional Guacamole

ujqNhwRx02EmPOjj_QGdIQ.text: Came here to end the celebrations for my friend's bachelorette party weekend and really loved it. The food was amazing (chili colorado is a MUST) and they were extremely flexible with our reservation as traffic and rain delayed us a bit. I'm from out of state but I've been raving about this restaurant since I got home.

ASvMqu5OyvX67PGTByPm_Q.text: Returning to Phoenix for my second time and also my second visit to Chico Malo.  Truly fresh and has a really great vibe... Worth visiting for sure. Friendly staff, great  margaritas excellent guacamole. The award winning pork Verde's is truly award winning it's a must try. It's a portion worth sharing

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Verde with fingering potatoes

TziieAL6WaMArlpQvDs-rw.text: Recently I found myself downtown for a retreat and was able to hang out at four City Scape venues. Our first dinner was at Chico Malo. Great vibe and atmosphere. There were eight of us in the party and there was no wait and they were able to accommodate us quickly. The big take away from the entire dinner was our waiter who I believe was named Caleb (at least that's what we will be calling him for this review).   Caleb took our drink orders and gave us a thorough education on the tequilas we were ordering so we could make educated decisions before paying for alcohol. I think most of the party would have said they knew what they liked and didn't need the documentary, but Caleb did a great job encouraging us to try things and step out of what we knew without being a car salesman.   Chips were served with a selection of dipping options. We had your traditional salsa but they also served a type of hummus made from ground white corn with a pesto like drizzle that was great.   Where the disappointment came in was in the meal itself. We ordered short ribs, ceviche, pozado, and a dish called Chile Colorado. This is what I ordered personally and it was "fine" but that's about how all of us responded to our entree's. Mostly we were disappointed by the cost to food satisfaction. It wasn't that it tasted bad, but it just didn't blow us away for $16!   Going back to 'Caleb' he observed that one of our party wasn't eating much and was slowly picking at her meal. He volunteered to bring out something else to her satisfaction but she was worried about holding back the rest of us. When Caleb brought the bill, he had taken it off entirely, and apologized that they had not met her expectations and hoped she would come back and try something else.   At the end of the day; it was on THAT comment alone that I give Chio Malo 4 stars rather than 3. They do deserve another visit since there were other menu items I would be willing to try. When I DO return if given the chance, I'll ask for Caleb, or whatever his name is!

Y_-EGXv_VtoLE0ZfSMXavg.text: I had a great experience here when I came with my friends for my birthday dinner. Brie was our server and she was sweet and attentive. Peter was knowledgeable about the tequila and mezcal selection. We split the trio of two salsas and the guacamole. Some of the best guacamole I've tried. For my entree I ordered the chimichanga and it was delicious! I was told everything on the menu is relatively mild, so our server brought us a selection of house made hot sauces. This was a great place to celebrate and I would definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chimichanga

WqDp8bmrm7pH72xCYAORQQ.text: Talk to your bartenders, people! Our group was discussing potential orders and I was talking about Margarita Monday as a concept, then our bartender offered us an unpublished drink special on margaritas. They were delicious and strong (and it wasn't just my lightweight self who thought so). Paul is the best bartender ever and he always has something special up his sleeve. Go get some apple pie moonshine before it's not seasonal anymore!   The facility is hip and the outdoor bar has a great vibe to it. It has a cool bar-like feel without being too loud, so nice for a small group to hang out and relax.   Food wise, the guacamole is a great shareable to put some food in your stomach. If you're going for a meal, the tacos al pastor do not disappoint.

1rjse1l_4Omzzgu1CI3b2A.text: Oh man. I had the chimichanga and ceviche  and it was some of the best food I've eaten in a LONG time.   When we first walked in we asked for a seat at the bar & we were seated pretty quickly (it was a Tuesday around 8pm). The bar has an extensive tequila menu with some other spirits for the lesser refined tastebuds (lol!).   The menu has a nice variety and I almost couldn't decide what to get but I'm SOOOO happy I got the chimichanga. I'd fly her from SF for this, I swear.   Food came out quick and was a good temp, not sizzling but warm enough for me to dive right in.  Our server, who I assume works bar too, was a little snarky at the beginning and I didn't like that. BUT after asking him for a bunch of stuff, including their HOMEMADE, yes made in house fresh crema, he warmed up to us.   He gave us a bunch of history on the restaurant/building and was super appreciative when we praised the food so I'd be happy to sit in his section again.   Overall... food and service was great and I'll be dreaming of that chimichanga tonight.

uFgon9Cr6-4niSacbSNmxw.text: Excellent food!!  So happy to fine this restaurant in downtown Phoenix!!  Great options for everyone in our group, several with dietary restrictions and allergies.  Everyone was able to find something delicious to enjoy!  The house margaritas were definitely a hit, as well as the cauliflower!  Everything was amazing and the service was excellent.  Definitely will be going back time and time again!!

We called for some veggie quesadilla and the stuffed relleno along with some chips. The food arrived but we never got our chips and salsa! The service was pretty slow even durint non-rush hours. Food taste ok, the portion size was decent.

XUeqjXyxxWMVFzd5VFSeow.text: Stopped by to try a new restaurant. Cute restaurant in a great location! Right in front of the city scape ice rink.   Let's start off with the service. Our waiter (Mario) and the manager (Peter)  were AMAZING!  We had a small problem with the corn and it was taken care of immediately although we did not want to complain since we were really here more for the views and to just enjoy the night.   Now let's talk about the food. The elote was delicious although it did lack a little Chile de polvo to make it feel authentic. The el pastor tacos we amazing. The meat was tender and it was flavorful. The dessert.... oh my the dessert!!! The churros were so soft... so so soft and probably the best thing I had here.   The beer was cold and the wine was at the right temperature.   I would recommend this place and we will be back.

gJRh2jzCiCo0zlKq2waK9Q.text: Great spot in a cool part of downtown.  We couldn't drink that day, however the food was tasty and good. We got the happy hour corn dish called "Elote."   Quite possibly the best thing I have ever had while being on Yelp.  We got one for appetizer and said screw it and got another one for dessert.  Get it.   Tacos were good.  The best ones were surely the fried avocado and pork green chili.  The others were average but these tacos and the Elote make it worth the stop.

He was ready to answer our questions and offer suggestions. This is upscale Mexican food. The decor is so great and the place is very open and spacious. They have only been open for 4 months but looks like they have it together. We ordered guacamole, different types of tacos and the coconut rice (so so good). I also tried their mezcal margarita and it was excellent!

MitrqnSBTsfJCyz48R_d-Q.text: Good salad combos, excellent Margy with attention to details like the toasted lime. (Loved  that!) Consistent service from all servers.

T-QeDHrZ6urOvT0mLrVn4w.text: Chico Malo did not disappoint. My boyfriend surprised me for my birthday with 5 of my close friends Saturday night. Our server Nate was amazing and attentive. He patiently indulged my never ending menu questions and accommodated my equally annoying special diet considerations.  Everyone LOVED their dinners. Cocktails were equally lovely and overall we are new fans and can't wait to come back and try more on the menu. Portions were great, the salsa flight was sooo good. I ordered the green chili chicken, others got the short ribs, shrimps tacos, chimis and a salad that looked incredible. I would highly recommend coming here for any occasion!  Thank you Nate for making my special day even more special!

YfFVe5KOZnXILaXNrMZzfA.text: Had the sugar skull drink with a pineapple and rum drink. Too strong! Nonetheless I drank it after adding more pineapple in it. My daughter had the French toast. It was delicious with French baguettes and caramelized bananas and yummy cinnamon syrup sauce. I ordered the Steak Tomahawk platter with grilled veggies and guacamole. We were very excited but it was too rare and half the steak was pure fat and gristle. NOT HAPPY. We were too starved to send it back to cook a bit  more. Not worth the $80.00. The service was very slow. We loved the restaurant itself. It's beautiful and very artistic with the beautiful Mexican inspired murals. My daughter and I really enjoyed it.

LVoOB28fLM1EojdNUjm4TQ.text: While visiting for a conference, I stopped by during happy hour and had one of their $6 margaritas - even though it was 3 minutes until 6, the bartender was super friendly and offered the HH menu. I also ordered their chips with salsa roja and a Mexico City Quesadilla (neither on the HH menu as I chose to steer away from it for my food because I had my heart set on a quesadilla). Both were perfectly sized for happy hour time and the quesadilla was delicious. The chips and salsa were average - I don't know many places that can make these stand out, so that's not a negative to me. Overall, the food was fantastic, service was great and the outside bar area was neat.

HAm-YU32vVYnxT1qaVsrUw.text: Best parts: decor and service! Decor is very cool and on trend. The back wall has a very awesome painting on books. Server was great. Unfortunately I don't recall his name but he had a sweet Aaliyah sweatshirt on. The food was good, but in an area with a lot of great Mexican food it just didn't compare. Guacamole and salsa were tasty. I had the al pastor tacos and the SO had green chili chicken. They were both tasty, just not exciting. I think I would definitely head back to hang out and have drinks but probably not for a meal.

Uwgu4Z2o9J_ekc2nuz48uw.text: If you are in the downtown Phoenix area, check out Chico Malo. I had the chimichanga and thought I had a good taste full of flavor and good size chunks of chicken. The price is a little on the high side, so bring a little extra cash. To me their salsa tasted plain and the guacamole had a good taste but needed more salt. I will go back soon and I will update you guys on whether my initial thoughts are on solid ground. Chow!

6LpR0kwkRIJr9F_rifizQw.text: This place was super yummy. We came here for lunch and the staff got us seated quickly. We ordered the Traditional guacamole tasted like it was sweetened which I wasn't a huge fan of but it was still good. The queso cheese dip was good but wasn't the drippy- cheese you'd be used to. It was like a thick melted block of cheese in a mini iron skillet which was kind of hard to "dip" and because you kind of had to grab it in between the tortilla. Nonetheless it was still yummy! I got the 3 for $10 tacos with the Crispy Avocado taco, the Diablo Shrimp taco, and the Machaca taco (pictured left to right). Crispy Avocado taco had a really nice fried, crispy outside that was really satisfying and the shrimp Diablo Shrimp taco had a bit of good spice to it, but my favorite was definitely the Machaca taco. The shredded beef in it was seasoned to perfection and with the corn tortillas, it was unmatched. The size of the tacos are more like street tacos but were very filling if you get the 3 for $10. It was a little slow because they were understaffed but the politeness and food made up for the speed of service. Interior was trendy and would be good for parties up to maybe 6 at a normal booth. Loved it!

G66TAe7xmEA1Tv3UCSsKcg.text: Ordered the shrimp tacos, they were ok, not outstanding, just not much flavor to them.  Chips, salsas, and guacamole were good.  Service was good, as well as the atmosphere.

ZfL9QVJA6CLNI46WjTUGSA.text: If you love mezcal you must go to Chico Malo. They have curated an amazing selection of artisanal mezcals to choose from. Order a flight or ask their super knowledgeable bar manager Peter to craft you a flight of his current favorites. Plus the food is just like nana made. My favorite is the pozole .

MrhJ_1b321MrmJ4Xxs6nzQ.text: Gotta give credit where credit is due here. Eaten at this place twice now. The second time was yesterday while they were serving their brunch menu (which I didn't know about so didn't check beforehand) and there was not a single vegan option on it. I mentioned the situation to the waitress and the kitchen manager came over to talk to me. The chef hooked it up! Made me a vegan dish anyways and it was delicious!   I think there should be one vegan option At least on every menu ... especially with the way things are going these days but being able to accommodate me anyways was huge in my book.   Good food, great service .. good drinks. Great atmosphere .. nice patio!

NfdRF_TOOlSR8N0JcUg8zA.text: Worst service I've received in my life. And I go out to eat a lot. Didn't talk to me at all, I wanted to leave the tab open but instead she closed it out and asked to pay. So I payed and went somewhere else. Didn't have any of the food so I can't comment about that:

L3ivjhzD7EZzFN1uAbuqBA.text: Went for happy hour and it was great! Service was top notch. Food was delicious, we had chips with the salsa trio with tacos and the price was right! Definitely check this place out if you are in Downtown Phoenix

tknTzRcpUlt0JpMm555BlA.text: Maybe Squid Ink Sushi being closed wasn't a bad thing after all.  Having binged out on tacos a mere two days ago (Tacotopia!), I wasn't sure I was ready to partake in tacos. But I did, and it was a good decision.  Ordered the tradito tuna and a flight of tacos (we do that in California), which consisted of duck carnitas, polla tinga, and crispy avocado. They are street taco size (fit in your hand), but they loaded a sizeable portion of filling in each one. Also sipped on a glass of house red , which was described as a cab blend coming off close to a pinot. And we all know how I get around pinots...  The crispy avocado was a fried/tempura avocado slice on a bed of red cabbage. It was different, but nothing to write home about.  The pollo tinga was tasty; loaded such that it broke my tortilla.  The DUCK CARNITAS is what you want. Man, so good, I thought I ordered the short rib by mistake! I could've eaten another one, but body said, "No, that's enough calories for today."  Three tacos will hit the spot for you, unless you come in uber hungry. I'll be back tomorrow to try their Bad Boy Brew (cold brew & horchata)!

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The taco flight: duck carnitas, pollo tinga, and crispy avo.
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tradito tuna appetizer. Slices of purple yam.
Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacotopia had me at 17 tacos... am I ready to go back in?

pbbH9pXbLGofLI8LE-ynPQ.text: Reading the reviews on Chico Malo is a little sad. I have already been to Chico Malo twice since their opening approximately three weeks ago. The food, staff, and drinks are all really good! The happy hour is pretty solid with $5 margaritas (which are great) and some discounted small plates.   The first time we went, we were served by Angel (I LOVE YOU), and he was great! He gave us suggestions and our drinks were always full. The chips and salsa (verde and montezuma) are a must when starting. The montezuma salsa is a bit different, but it's excellent. I believe I have tried every taco on their menu and was not disappointed with any of them. My favorites have to be pollo tinga, chorizo and papas, and the short rib.   I see that people are mostly complaining about the prices on the tacos. Yes, they are priced higher than tacos that you get on the street for 50 cents, however, the ingredients that Chico Malo is using are fresh and also from local businesses. The tortillas are made in house and are perfect. You are paying more for the quality of these tacos, which is totally worth it.   Chico Malo is a great restaurant! The decor and wait staff is super nice. I'm excited to see the restaurant progress.

DW9aRJLqFMh1ooK3q8KOFA.text: Everything at Chico Malo is amazing! From the fresh made chips and salsa all the way to the dessert! This is a modern take on Mexican food that you will not find at any other place here in Phoenix. They have a house made grapefruit soda that they put in their Loma Bonita and it is to die for. (I had 3 ;))  Apps: The Nichie Nachos - Creamy and cheesy, TO DIE FOR! The Pork Belly Tostada had an egg cream that complimented the black bean puree.   You must get the Puerco beans to compliment your tacos.   I've been to Chico Malo a few times so I've tried almost all the tacos they offer. My favorite is the pork belly! Its spicy and sweet.   If you are going for dinner I would suggest the Layered Pollo Fundido that comes with a braised chicken leg on the side or the Chile Ribeye that melts in your mouth.   Finally, are the desserts!!! I ordered the Pineapple Chili Panna Cotta and my husband ordered the Tres Leches Rice pudding. Both were outstanding. I cannot wait to go back and try some of their salads at lunch. Till next time!

cZrRgbGyGSrVmZWRuGg-RA.text: Good food, good service.  Good happy hour.  Ambiance is clean and contemporary.  I ordered everything they had on the happy hour menu and the prices for the portions were great.  Great place to enjoy happy hour with friends!  Don't orfer the sangria.  It is $11 and only served in an 8oz glass.  Beautiful but I felt robbed.  It tasted bad, too.  My mistake, though.  Next time I'll drink beer.

thr89zbzpVkjqtJejkM_Rg.text: Great drinks and happy hour specials. The fish wasn't very good but the lamb shank was delicious. Andre's service was exceptional. The atmosphere is fun and if you want to watch a game, sit at the bar.

_Q_RpZBM0DotqG6FinZZ6Q.text: Made a reservation for opening night, as it's been a highly anticipated restaurant to open in the downtown Phoenix scene. The decor and environment compliments the artistic scene of downtown Phoenix, yet they stand apart from other Mexican restaurants in the valley.  I went with a large group of friends, so we can all taste the different variety of options. Drink selection was okay. I was expecting more.   To start, we ordered the guacamole, and it did not really have any flavor. We even added chicharones and bananas, but there was something missing that we couldn't pin-point. It just tasted like an avocado-banana smoothie. The guac came with three salsas (that needed salt) and the hottest salsa was not spicy.   I ordered the Baja Fish tacos, which I do recommend. Also, I ordered the shrimp ceviche which lacked flavor of traditional shrimp ceviche. The avocado underneath took away from the other unique fruits and veggies that were added.  I want to say there was more avocado then ceviche.) We also ordered Chicken Tinga, Pastor, Carne Asada, and Duck tacos. The most popular ones among the group were the Duck and Carne asada tacos.   Overall, the customer service experience was phenomenal, but the food did not cut it. It was honestly disappointing, because I was expecting more. I know this was the grand opening, so I will give Chico Malo a second chance :)

0nzZCUXcxLQ27fGDjNV8YA.text: This is the best Mexican restaurant. It has an authentic Mexican taste that runs through your mouth. Every bite is a pleasure. If you visit Down Town Phoenix you must come to Chico Malo. YOU WON'T REGRET IT..

CqvN_TIIh_yv44Ui7bxpuw.text: The drinks, food, and service here were all great. Disappointing to see the low reviews, but it seems like most people are commenting on how it was overpriced. Yes it's a little pricey, but this is something you should check out before you go to a place. Sometimes unique recipes and quality ingredients result in higher prices. I had a duck carnitas with candied pecans and pickled red onions. It was not tiny, contrary to what most people are saying, very tasty, and where else can you get duck carnitas??  Also, had two mezcal drinks with charcoal that were strong--pretty much all booze--for $10 each. Pretty standard for a cocktail that is all liquor. Also, the montezuma salsa some of the best salsa I've had in my life, if not the best. Also, the server was dope. I will concede that the guac is objectively overpriced (but still delicious) and was not completely stoked on the chorizo taco. People are haters.

FgGkte649L4vVBaE8TfY9g.text: Great spot downtown. They have a wide range of tacos, 3 for $10, however they are only available during lunch. They don't have the same range of tacos on the dinner menu. We are lucky the hostess could care less about her job and gave us both menus. The sever was able to get the chef to let us have the taco special. The green chili taco was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green chili, chicken tinga and beef with mole tacos.

HikKca6S7v_mVP_HsMC7vw.text: Fun place... good service, although we were looking for more of a Tapas place - Chico Malo doesn't necessarily have a menu meant for that. Service was good, we had a guy named Jared who took some pics of our group and was totally awesome with applying filters... and actually sold us on what's called "La Calavera" which is a drink for 4, by saying it's totally perfect for Instagram - ha! With regards to the food, it was good although it's not exactly traditionally prepared. The value was ok... it's location sorta implies that it'll be spendy, and I would say that that was True. I would make the recommendation... if you're in the area.

xwAMEif7um_ilHacVdXFYQ.text: We were so excited to try the long awaited Chico Malo. We came before the lunch rush to ensure a good experience. We each had one. They were okay.... but would need at least 3 to be considered a meal portion. I'm not trying to pay $30 for lunch on the regular. We will stick to our tried and True.

bioWZIjPHO_z3CmGLmi76g.text: Worst service ever. Took 20 minutes to get our first drink at the bar while we waited, got seated, took another 30 minutes to get our drinks at our table. Ordered and they screwed up the order completely and then they tried to make it right by removing the guacamole that never came  and then billed us for it. Go somewhere else.

sy7RjCffKIV5xL2JAmn8Bg.text: Chef driven with great service and fair pricing. Chico Malo lived up to the hype and delivered an awesome culinary experience. 2Axddg8np8q3qKT3GJj0KA.text: From the service to the food, this is one of the best spots in Phoenix! The service was fast and friendly, and the food is incredible! The cherry pecan mole on the duck carnitas is ridiculous. This spot is a great way to get your night started!

lvfjY44-QKO-2R6S_50VHQ.text: Had the scallop ceviche and vegetable skewers (that came with this ridiculously good key lime cream). Staff was friendly, helpful, efficient. Portions were generous, so 1 appetizer + 1 side were enough for one person. Would definitely go back!

DsMLLlF4opNJ-rzc1X1lgQ.text: It was my first time here and I can say I probably will not be back. The food was mediocre. We ordered the queso fundido and shared the chimichanga. But the food was besides the point. Our server Melissa was rude. Her attitude was poor and it just seemed like she was upset to be doing her job. 0UCwqaLEnczUvpgEAg32xA.text: Creative twist on staple dishes. Food and drinks were delightful. Service was amazing as well. I loved the decor and ambiance as well. Can't wait to go back!

6fRtRkoN6mL4AMjTjkQKGw.text: Great concept! Finally downtown has a great Mexican place for drinks and dinner! Definitely make your own guacamole!

9Bj0EBOaM4orOZJ--zowXg.text: The drinks, food, and service was amazing! Their verde salsa was tasty, and their chimichanga was particularly delicious. All of their sauces were impressive! Our service was fantastic - shout out to Tara specifically. The music and vibe of the restaurant was really nice for a Friday night out. I will definitely be back!

mktEIuHEZfcNbmEyphJsgg.text: Great food and atmosphere. We loved your server and all the house made/ authentic Hispanic cuisine. If your ever in downtown Phoenix. AZ you would do yourself a disservice if you didn't come here and eat. Plus the drinks are awesome!!!!

qUTDcUT2RIY1W5ucPg_IQQ.text: Amazing brand new urban Mexican food restaurant  in the heart of downtown Phoenix at CityScape. There's not many Mexican food places in the area, so Chico Malo has the market and any other that tries to challenge will have hard time beating them. This new restaurant is amazing. The atmosphere and ambience is incredible and mind blowing with art installations and large murals that graffiti the walls. It has a bar, lounge dining room, and patio seating. Everything is made in house and rom scratch including their chips, tortillas, roja, verde, and signature Montezuma salsa that I would describe as if salsa and hummus had a baby. The food is delicious and a flavorful explosion. They put a great twist on some timeless Mexican traditional dishes and serve a variety of street tacos from duck carnitas to pork belly and chicken tinga that all complements well with their cocktail list that puts a spin on tequila and margaritas. They even have a tableside guacamole cart that is made fresh right in front of you. The staff and waiters are very friendly and upbeat and knowledge about the menu and what flavors to expect from the food as well as the cocktails. They are open for quick grab and go breakfast items as well as stout a quick lunch service to grab some tacos on your lunch hour and a sit down dining experience for dinner time. A burrito cart is slated to be up and running shortly too that will most likely cater to the after hours night life scene of downtown. This new restaurant is a must if you are downtown. Whether you are out to lunch or heading to a game, concert, or comedy show.

m-TpqVxmeKtEE8CILZefpQ.text: Didn't get an opportunity to eat here but absolutely love the management, especially sal. My friends and I were FREEZING waiting for our Uber and Chico Malo was closed but sal saw that we were really cold and allowed us to wait inside while they were closed. Thanks so much, sal :)

YHcXDtf6t0ipMjYtzdGceA.text: Amazing experience! My other half and I live downtown and we experience the different dining options in the valley frequently. We are always excited for new restaurants. Chico Malo blew us away! Really urban and unique interior experience. Great music...and the service was the best we have experienced. We were really Impressed with the different flavor combinations. Super tasty tacos and definitely try the rice. Our night got a thousand times better when we ordered the pineapple dessert. Most unique and best dish I've tried. Margaritas were perfect...we honestly enjoyed every bit. Super excited to have such a unique restaurant we can venture to on the regular.

F3Px5xDfkihwzkIikNkbYg.text: Love this downtown Phoenix Mexican restaurant. Food is fresh and creative. Nice assortment from the bar (finally a decent Paloma). Also, very helpful waiter who guided us through the gluten free options.

O-WnVvduh4-JDZ4krtdTzA.text: In town for a few days and tried some very good tacos. This place was recommended to me by a woman at my hotel and I will go back again

u44vZU8mkF9_NJn_2Wnugg.text: Dinner at Chico's before Stand up Live and it was a great choice.  Had a reservation and since we ordered 2 entrees got VIP entrance and seating to the show too - score.  The apps were great, had salsa rojo ame the Nueva Guac.  Love the extra flair with pomegranate and pumpkin seeds.  I had the lamb shank with comes with a cactus something risotto and thick homemade corn tortilla - exceptional combo.  Wife had the achiote half chicken with a little corn tamale thing - also fantastic. . . Only a carcass left on the plate.  Will be back.

iCZCBMLEtrcTLuaJMqh4Jw.text: Excellent food! Bartenders were excellent great atmosphere. Food came out in a timely manor. Great prices

NyjcPwejaPZwaWjfTpgPKQ.text: Awesome spot especially for downtown! The food is fantastic and I never leave unsatisfied. The trio is perfect to get started and we usually order a few different things to share. Good vibes and great staff! Now that the weather is ideal, sitting outside on the patio is my favorite place to go!

S0grmYpQX-hs5YQlcwGYqg.text: This place is simply amazing! They have a marvelous selection of tequilas and make some of the best drinks I've ever had with it. We had their chips and salsa, as well as most of their happy hour items - which shouldn't be skipped! Our server Joe was on top of everything with helpful suggestions.  Some of their dishes take 15 hours to prepare. You won't find the cheapest fare here, but quality costs. I promise, they will wow you.

_kcWrubtwIPdxwlJJeTuPw.text: We had the al pastor tacos. They were very dry, the pineapple brought in some much needed moisture & sweetness but over all were lacking flavor. The margaritas were top notch.

BmDJ0y_Ok3m8HPV0LEpvBg.text: Happy hour is a must here!! **thumbs up** House margarita was yumm. Really pleased with the quality of drinks and especially the quality of food. Staff was great and very knowledgeable of the area. Chile Relleno here is beyond words, super good. Had the shrimp ceviche, good, not great. Oh, and another great thing about this place is that they did a really great job attending to our large party [20+ people]. They always came by to see if we were ready for another round before our drinks got too low.

aOknBW4d8sgbJn_kwSb-VA.text: Service was exceptional. Grant recommended great vegetarian options for my friend and I and who don't eat meat. Sal also helped us out every step of the way. When you come in, ask for these two;)

Z300jpA1CWNZZUfqPHr3dw.text: Neil Diamond concert was Fabulous! Left Talking stick Arena and they handed out redeem tickets for 2$ off till midnight. So we checked it out. Not only was the customer service great my carne asada taco was amazing! Maya our server is awesome and after a amazing concert this establishment is perfect for a cocktail and a little bite eats!! We will come back for sure!!

3omc104l0KbXLkcrp-VirA.text: Went here for the heavenly Duck Tamale, stayed here for the Tacos AL Pastor and delicious home made corn tortillas. Excellent service and atmosphere. Preferably get a reservation because this place fills up fast.

1guNN4B7AqFMZ6kZ9x9nWg.text: Went Saturday night before the Eagles concert and was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere was great, the service was top notch and the food was awesome! Would highly recommend it and would definitely visit again!

xavOLSNBHd-AiNFiEvalWg.text: This is a great place to hit prior to any event downtown. The accessibility was easy. The evening we attended, we made a reservation and was given assigned seating for the comedy club. Not sure if that is a norm, but might be nice to ask. The server was fun and helpful. Food was a bit slow coming out, but it was a busy Fri evening. The food was worth the bit of waiting. So very delicious and lots of flavors that all worked together beautifully. Only draw back, really noisy. Was hard to visit with my friends but all the good outweighed that little bad. Def recommend...

P1O3cZbpc0Fntp5AhiVKyA.text: Our new favorite spot! Has a little bit of everything on the menu and it all looks sooo good and just a little different than the typical. Very unique flavor.  We couldn't decide so we ordered everything on the happy hour menu and enjoyed it all. The Papas con chorizo were the perfect bite size and the chorizo wasn't too oily.  The only feedback is for the corn/elote, I would have liked to have the option to eat it on the cob or have them shave it maybe table side.  Mario was our server and he was awesome, friendly, fun and on top of everything.

iVhTTWczcSBovoa06A-KtQ.text: What a wide variety of flavors for the pallette  to enjoy.

tQRvO3AmJfO-zCdPU0BWpw.text: Reserved the patio for a group of 17. Drinks were great. Food was good. Service was pretty good. Would've like to have seen him a bit more frequently to check on us. Everyone said they enjoyed the experience, and I appreciated that they didn't rush us... our bar tab obviously reflected that... lol will definitely use them again.

6MPWIzZ-Nhmq-BF1IzKifg.text: I don't see myself going back there. The service was kinda terrible. At first I felt guilty for never noticing the place because I frequent Stand Up Live. But now I just don't care.  The servers gave us (there was about 12 of us) attitude in the form of rolled eyes and telling me to "hold on" while they're giving part of my order to someone else. And I guess I should be more specific when asking for water. The water out of my facet is colder than what they gave us. I'm not going to go into everything. It was overall an unpleasant experience. The staff is made up of inexperienced, seemingly privileged little snots that could use some training and some work ethic.   To end on a positive note:  Although they took forever, the drinks and tacos were delicious.

iYra-dMjET_3puqt2tGJWQ.text: The $6 margarita was good.  I didn't try the food but I will come back with my GF for that.  Thank you for being responsive Chico Malo.

whNVyItK9irPPOVDDzNygA.text: This is a cool place. Great service and the food is amazing! Oh my God, I am definitely coming back

M2xCe2XuuL-gCZc4aI3zJA.text: Chico Malo did a lovely job hosting a 100 person reception in their back room recently for us.  They were very professional, with a "can-do" attitude and receptive to anything we wanted to do.  They were very easy to work with, and the bar and wait staff did a great job. The event was supposed to end at 10pm when the place closed, but they had no problem with us staying later--which is why I increased the tip!  Appetizers were great, drinks worked out perfectly.  I'd highly recommend them.

14qdYrwDUQvzApJc9AHOJg.text: We had a great meal there.  Honestly when we looked at the menu we were concerned because you do not see typical Mexican restaurant dishes by name.   I had the Chimichanga and wife the Carne Asada.  We shared and both were excellent quality and presented very well.  Overall a great experience that started a bit tentative.  All the foods I saw delivered around me appeared to be similarly well done.  Would go there again.

7JE3JR8t6iNcyNYee0gP8w.text: We went to this place last night as a consolation prize since we couldn't get into the Christmas pop up bar and I was so pleased!! The food was so good, that flavor profiles were complex and interesting, and everyone at the table was amazed by how many unique flavors there were. The avocado tacos were a lot of fresh avocado and the pickled vegetable (beets??) were such a great compliment to the dish. The menu is short but great, but I was disappointed all of the mixed drinks were made with mezcal which is a Smokey tequila that I really can't stand. But they were very accommodating and got me a beer, then they even didn't charge us for dessert because it took a while to come out. Really impressive place!

FT5mhHyGHjVZKAoq8IxoUQ.text: So disappointed. Our server was very sour to say the least, not friendly at all. We ordered the chips trio which was ok but not spectacular. I ordered the duck confit tomales. The corn masa was very thick with a small amount I'm filling. It had mole  sauce and cheese on top of it. The only sauce was very bitter. The dish itself begged for a good dash of salt. It was not satisfactory in any way shape or form. Overall I found it frustrating that I spent  my calories in my money on this experience.

hbPHDIlJeoRJTp_Tlq5G_g.text: Love this place.  Our waiter Hector made the experience amazing!   Food and drink so solid!

rOBqgjXP0VLAdBO4Knb-jA.text: Food: 3.0 Service: 3.5 Ambiance: 4.0 Wait: 1.5 hrs  I dropped by Chico Malo on a Saturday night around 7:00 pm without a reservation (oh what a mistake on my part). I was told that it'd be a 30 min - 1 hr wait for a table for 2 and figured that I'd try and stick it out. Frankly, I expected to be called in about 40 minutes, but lo and behold that was not the case. My friend and I were seated roughly 1.5 hrs after we had initially put our names down. That being said, it was most likely our faults that we had such a long wait since we showed up at a popular place during peak hours on a Saturday.   Once we were seated our server brought over some water, took our drink orders, and then effectively disappeared for a while. He did eventually resurface to grab our food orders but after that 1.5 hr wait, we were both feeling somewhat impatient. Now it took quite some time for the food to come out though other parties around us who ordered food after us seemed to have at least something on the table. Now I understand that certain foods take a while to be prepped and made and all that, but I expected the chips and guacamole/salsa/mixed bean ceviche to be out quite quickly. The chips, however, took about 20 minutes to be brought out and our food came out immediately after.   We ordered the trio, the avocado tacos, the al pastor tacos, and the elote. The star of the night for me was the roja salsa in the trio whereas my friend said that the elote was his favorite. Now it's great that we found things we liked, but it was disappointing that they were basically appetizers rather than entrees. In terms of the entrees, my friend enjoyed the al pastor tacos, but felt that they were under seasoned. My avocado tacos were good, but a bit inconsistent. Two of the tacos on my plate were quite salty whereas the other one was super bland. Also, the crema used on the avocado tacos had a coconut undertone that I just did not appreciate very much. I ended up adding roja salsa to them in order to make them more palatable tbh.  I have a feeling that I will not return to this restaurant after my experience tonight, particularly if I don't have a reservation. The inside was beautiful but the noise level was super high, the service was very scattered, and the food just wasn't that great. I just feel that PHX has so many other places that do Mexican cuisine much better.

v9OYkk7_SQP6IK-nttT__w.text: We stopped in after a Suns Game- we are new to the area and just decided to grab a bite upon walking by. The salsas and chips were so good- full of flavor and tasted very fresh. We ordered the chimichanga, quesadilla and the vegetable side. The dishes were bursting with complex flavors that kept us going back for more until we finished every last bite. Such a pleasant surprise to stumble upon a great restaurant! Service was good! Loved the ambiance and music. Will definitely be back! Recommend 10/10 times.

FDXWIVM4NjMBiDaT99dSDg.text: My wife and I went to this restaurant for dinner.  We were not impressed with the service, we were less impressed with the food.    This place is downtown and parking will be a little difficult so plan on that aspect.  I don't care about parking and would never gauge a restaurant on how good the parking is, but just to let you know if you go.  We go to a lot of Mexican food restaurants here in Phoenix and anywhere we travel.  We enjoy great Mexican food.    When we walked in, at about 7:30PM on a Saturday night, the hostess looked at us like we made her mad.  She got up from her seat, grabbed two menus and said "this way".  I tried to make small talk but she would not even acknowledge me.  We sat at a nice table by the window and she was gone.  No personality at all and no enjoyment in what she was doing. Our waitress was nice and very attentive.  We were in a slight rush but she did not mind and we enjoyed her attitude.  She was the only bright star of the night.  We even asked her if the hostess was having a bad day and to let the manager know that she gives a very bad first impression.  We saw her walk over to what I assume was the manager and tell him something.  He just shook his head and she walked away.  This place talks a good deal about their bold approach to Mexican food and their name implies that this will be memorable.  From a food perspective, it was less than mediocre.  First, their salsa was bland and tasted like something you get from the grocery store.  The chips were stale and flavorless.  There was only one type of salsa and it had zero spicy-ness.  We ordered guacamole and it was OK.  Not the best, but ok.  We ordered street tacos to split, with three different fillings to get a flavor for what they had to offer.  They too were bland.  The plate came with Chorizo as an accompaniment.  It tasted ok but was less than room temperature.  We asked the waitress if it was supposed to be cold and she said "no".  She offered us a replacement but there was no need.  The other item on the plate was a crema guacamole paste that was inedible.    Overall I just do not think this place has good food.  Nothing tasted great, nothing stood out, and most was either bland, made poorly, or was not good.  We have so much to offer in Phoenix when it comes to great Mexican fare.  I would hate for a visitor to get the impression that this is anything close to our potential.

RZEml2rGvHbnjF0kDHePaQ.text: Great food, drinks and atmosphere. The Chili Colorado is amazing!!! Will definitely come back next time in Phoenix!!

IF1r3xVNHidCcNbPLdQ2Pg.text: Great location, nice decor and nice presentation of the food but I feel like more time/effort could went into the flavor. Also a bit expensive.  We had the chorizo and potato tacos (3), tacos al pastor (3), shrimp ceviche, side of rice, chips and guacamole and two drinks. We spent $85 with tip.  The rice lacked flavor, the sauce of some kind in the chorizo tacos was a bit odd. The ceviche was presented as almost a sushi type roll no liquids what so ever. I definitely wouldn't call any of the food "Mexican", it's more Mexican inspired dishes.  In my opinion, I think they are trying to do a little to much with the food. Sadly we will not be returning.  Tacos from a street corner truck are far better than what we had here.

ejAnkBeDSKcN7EL4_4lYRw.text: Had the Carne and shrimp add on. Very good. The blue corn tortillas are a must have. $4.00 Tecates were pretty nice too.

c427gzRvCkm5CeD7hPEi4A.text: I was staying at a hotel nearby & how busy this place was outside so I decided to stop in. Really fun decor, loved the accent lighting and giant metal chicken.   I was craving green spicy things so I had the salsa verde and the green chili chicken. Both were outstanding in both flavor and presentation. The salsa was bright and fresh. Just the right amount of acidity. The chicken had a wonderful warm smokey layer to it that hit the spot. Really friendly servers as well. Would absolutely come back here!

VZ83MZVwKmrglzsHRu7n7w.text: We dropped into this spot for an afternoon drink and food. Not disappointed at all. The ambiance was perfect and the bar facing the outdoor seating gave just the right balance of air conditioning to fresh air. The drinks were perfect. Food phenomenal and the service was seamless as we were there during a shift change. Very well managed establishment.

0aqY6dbViJUag7uRo31suQ.text: Amazing food and cool atmosphere. The servers are super cool people. The whole fish was phenomenal!!!!!! They have great appetizers. The one with guacamole and the vegan bean ceviche is the best! I'm not vegan in any way but the vegan bean ceviche was actually really really good. Went twice in one week because it was so good.

RdGCr4EAJptxpkV_B2G-Wg.text: Love this place. I was pleasantly surprised as I thought it was going to be sort of chichi. Turned out, the food was great and the michelada was muy deliciosa. The patio was also great too.

R66Q_6ENeyqRVRQpRdD2hg.text: The environment was great but my meal was not the same. I ordered three shrimp tacos and was disappointed when they arrived at my table. Although the presentation was great, it was disappointing that each taco had only 1 shrimp each. The taste of the actual shrimp was a bit odd and had a sour aftertaste.

j0nDs9keygTVvDtv6b5meA.text: Shrimp tacos and green chili was delish! They catered for a private event at cityscape and did a wonderful job. Those blue corn tortillas were perfect.

xpdYqC1IWk3oLwKfL44goQ.text: Nice variety of nouveau Tex-Mex, they warn you if a cocktail is 'spirit-forward', good chance to learn lots of foodie vocab, some terms I had not come across in my travels.  Had a good mole dish. And a negro something that charcoal with mescal (?) very different and adventurous

photos.caption: Photo of Chico Malo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Heavy duty! Abismo Negro.

oPZAGNCiptLfR573Ete2uw.text: First timers and maybe there were some delicious food options we missed but the menu was limited and overall our food was just so-so. The waiter was very nice. The drinks were good. Just wish the food would've been tastier.

N1jYQ0e5NB4Yu6JGjr4C4Q.text: My friend and I chose Chico Malo for lunch last Saturday, and we're glad we did.   The service was great. He approached us and asked if we had been there before. After we said no, he welcomed us by walking us through the menu, highlighting some of his favorite things, and asking if we wanted something to drink. He is knowledgeable about the food items and drinks.   We shared a chip and salsa to start and then split the chicken tinga ahogada torta The two things together were enough to kill the hunger. The drinks were also good. The loma bonita is pretty strong with the housemade tequila. The paraiso tropical is refreshing because it's a cava-base. We also briefly tried the alebrije, but it was too smokey for us (which the waiter did describe). The chicken torta was definitely the star of the meal. It was flavorful, and the "smoked english pea guac" just worked. Strange, but it was really good.   I haven't been to many places around cityscape, but I wouldn't mind coming back!

IAIksMeE4jWWtRhOlp6q9w.text: "Stumbled" upon this place walking around Downtown Phoenix. It was pretty busy on a Saturday night so decided to give it a try. I had the chicken chimichanga which had an amazing flavor! Not spicy, just full of flavor! The guacamole, red and green salsa and chorizo where outside the chimichanga on the same plate so you could try each separately. This was great as each bite was a little different depending on what ingredient you had! Even without any of those add ones it was still delicious! I also had the alebrije drink. Overall a good drink but wouldn't call it amazing. The waiter was nice and food came out quite fast. The chimichanga looked smaller than I'm used to but was very filling! It is a nicer restaurant on the more expensive side so something to keep in mind.. but such good flavor still a 5 star!

VEEdpL1FqQxDaIo2cZufMQ.text: We are staying Phoenix for the weekend. Found this place- it was across from our hotel. Had dinner here last and it was so amazing we had to come back for breakfast. Holy crap!!! The most amazing brunch ever!!!! A must  stop if you are in the area!!!

qEb8uYvOFAJTaeet1e_q_Q.text: Enjoyed the food. Different from Mexican or Tex Mex. Sat outside, nice atmosphere. Everyone enjoyed.
